[i] Title: Alita and Samus Enter the Cyberpunk Mosh Pit

[Scene: A dimly lit arcade room with a flickering neon sign above an arcade cabinet labeled "UBERMOSH." Alita Battle Angel and Samus Aran approach the machine with a gleam of excitement in their eyes.]

Alita: Hey, Sammy, check this out! It's called UBERMOSH.

Samus: Sounds like our kind of party, Alita. Let's dive in!

[Alita and Samus insert coins and select their characters, ready for action as the game begins.]

Alita: (as her character wields a sword) Whoa, look at these bullets flying!

Samus: (blasting enemies with her arm cannon) This is like a cybernetic ballet of destruction!

Alita: (dodging bullets with finesse) Ha! Can't touch this!

Samus: (unleashing a barrage of missiles) Eat missiles, you pixelated punks!

Alita: (slicing through bullets with precision) Slice and dice, baby! Alita's in her element!

Samus: (evading with agility) Dodging bullets like a pro!

Alita: (laughing) Muahaha! This is exhilarating!

Samus: (blasting enemies with precision) Take that, and that, and a little bit of this!

Alita: (eliminating enemies with efficiency) Target neutralized! Next!

Samus: (interacting with power-ups) Check out these upgrades! Samus just leveled up!

Alita: (hacking through obstacles) Ha! Take that, you pesky barriers! Alita hacks faster than lightning!

Samus: (analyzing the gameplay) This is like a high-speed dance of death!

[As Alita and Samus progress through the levels, they become increasingly immersed in the adrenaline-fueled chaos of UBERMOSH.]

Alita: (defeating a boss) Boss down! Alita's the queen of the cyberpunk mosh pit!

Samus: (analyzing the boss's weaknesses) Ha! Your weaknesses are as obvious as a Space Pirate's attack pattern!

Alita: (hacking through security systems) Access granted! Alita and Samus, breaking through barriers like pros!

Samus: (unleashing a final onslaught) Brace yourselves, enemies! It's game over for you!

[After their intense gaming session, Alita and Samus step away from the cabinet, their faces flushed with excitement.]

Alita: That was epic! UBERMOSH is like a turbocharged adrenaline rush!

Samus: Totally! The fast-paced action and tight controls make it a real blast to play.

Alita: And the randomly generated levels keep things fresh every time. It's like never-ending cybernetic chaos!

Samus: Plus, the retro-inspired graphics and pumping soundtrack really set the mood. It's like stepping into a cyberpunk fever dream!

Alita: Absolutely! UBERMOSH is a must-play for anyone looking for a quick dose of arcade adrenaline. I give it five stars!

Samus: Agreed! Five stars from me too. Now, who's up for another round?

[As Alita and Samus head back to the arcade cabinet, their laughter echoes through the room, inspiring others to join in the cybernetic mosh pit madness.] [/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198047202639', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1696229968}
review:
I absolutely love Ubermosh! This game is a non-stop adrenaline rush with its fast-paced gameplay and intense combat mechanics. The visuals are sleek and stylish, and the soundtrack keeps me pumped up throughout each round.

One thing I really appreciate about Ubermosh is how unforgiving it is. The difficulty level is high, but it just makes each victory that much more satisfying. You really have to stay on your toes and be quick with your reflexes to survive in this game.

Overall, Ubermosh is a challenging and rewarding experience that I would highly recommend to any fan of arcade-style shooters. It's addictive, exciting, and a ton of fun. Give it a try if you're looking for a game that will test your skills and keep you coming back for more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198350478490', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1707777742}
review: The first in a long-running series of frantic, unique, and enjoyable games, UBERMOSH is extremely enjoyable and volume 1 is far less RNG dependent than the future installments. For the price and amount of enjoyment, I would absolutely recommend this game, it is absolutely worth the price. It takes a solid couple runs to understand the mechanics and not die within a couple moments of starting a run, but once you get the hang of it, you go into a sort of flow that I haven't been able to find in any larger games, the UBERMOSH series, POST VOID, Devil Daggers and Hyper Demon being the only games that have given me the same feeling. The only downside I can pin onto this game is how repetitive it gets after a couple of hours. I could see some people playing this game for hundreds of hours, getting the absolute highest score possible, but for most people the cap may be closer to two hours of gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1705774686}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right handâ€”the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bedâ€”the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278942181', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1683697524}
review:
The game that started it all.

Definitely not the most incredible out of the ubermosh line, but it's from this game's framework that other masterpieces were made. If you dislike this game for a lack of variety, don't allow it to let you down, maybe try another UBERMOSH game. 

For me personally all of Walter's games are worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198361671357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 409, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1702576422}
review:
UBERMOSH is an awesome, fast-paced bullet hell survival game. 

The game is relatively simple but requires quick reflexes and a good dodging ability. All you have to defend yourself is your blade, the key to deflecting enemy projectiles. There will be plenty of projectiles coming your way. Embrace the inner ninja within you, precision is key in this game, you only have to survive 90 seconds, but that's enough time to get your whole world turned upside-down.

Walter Machado always seems to make short, addictive arcade-like games and this game further increases my love for his work. Do give this one a try, it's brilliant!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011250864', 'num_games_owned': 1900, 'num_reviews': 359, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1698015074}
review:
Got this and the other through a bundle, decided to finally try them out.

Bullet hell, survive 90 seconds and get a good score. There is an element of strategy where you need to time blocks and reflect attacks, gather better weapons for wider spread of fire and moving/maintaining chock points.
However your screen is too small, there are too many enemies flooding, not enough choke points, enemies that try and kite your block to later shoot, you dont have enough time to see some shots, you cant lock the gun you picked up. It becomes vexing.

Oh, and the fact I cant turn down the music in the game....

I guess its for people who want to "get good". Im more interesting in having fun.

3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198098598569', 'num_games_owned': 619, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1694909611}
review: UBERMOSH is a game that requires intense focus, quick reflexes, and perhaps even a little bit of luck. At first I hated this game because it seemed impossible to accomplish anything worth bragging about but I got to the point where I was able to get 199 kills yielding the WARLOCK MASTERY achievement as well as an S+ ranking. I guess for some this may not sound that impressive but I have Tourette Syndrome so for me playing a game like this where looking away from the screen for a second can be enough to ruin a run it just makes the endeavor that much more of an uphill battle. As I write this review knowing that I was only 2 kills away from also getting the KENSAI MASTERY achievement in my last run I can confidently say that I've grown quite fond of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004492389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 331, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1693392033}
review:
While going through cheap games to check out, I picked up this title. It's a minimalist arcade game where you shoot enemies and cut them up in equal measure. It's best described as a mix between Hotline Miami, Vampire Survivors, and Ultrakill (the latter two releasing after Ubermosh).

The voice over that you hear in the trailer is present when you first load the game too. He genuinely sounds like a mix between Morgan Freeman and David Attenborough. Any time you switch game modes or play the game for the first time, you'll hear him. "The colony provides us everything... except for violence, that... we still find on the deserts of Ultakaar, if you get hurt... you'll be teleported back and wake up in one piece. For now, welcome to Ubermosh."

The enemies are varied and there is some tactics, but it's just the bare minimum. It's one of the shorter games you'll end up playing, and evidently, me too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014937076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1692901467}
review:
Got this gifted from a homie today, great little arcade shooter. Fast paced af and seems impossible at first but if you can figure out some of the kiting/survival strats it makes it way easier to survive till the end and score higher. I mainly played hardboiled difficulty so I could get a higher kill count so I cant say much for casual.
Use your blade over your gun in tight situations. Pick a group of walls/islands to kite around so you are not getting pressed 360 (but do not clip them for an instadeath). And grab that big gun as soon as possible. EZ!

author: {'steamid': '76561199212764808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1699652776}
review:
A very solid acrade-style game series, and I've bought the whole package for only $0.24.
Music is good. Art is good. Enemies are smart. Movement is fluid. Parrying bullets is fun.

There is a problem, though. It is poorly optimized. It freezes frequently, killing all of your progress. But this game is more or else stable, unlike the following titles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116100475', 'num_games_owned': 4782, 'num_reviews': 597, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1686604411}
review:
Shooting screen is so small and enemies not shooting untill they are nearly in my face.
There are better games out there, even it it's only 0,27â‚¬ on sale.

Everything else about the game is great, but the camera is ruining it for me. This is coming from a hardcore gamer who loves to play bullet hell and all kinds of old school shmup games. It doesn't want to be too close (as in this case) or too far. A lot of old shmup games have found that sweet spot unlike... here.

author: {'steamid': '76561199039307190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1685198297}
review: I find this game quite fun. Although it has really small content, it is worth for the price (At least for me since i bought the game in a bundle with the entire UBERMOSH series at a cheap price, which i'll play the other game of this series later) and once you find a class you like and go into the "fun zone", you can play this game for hours. What i don't really like about this game is that there's no settings tab, which i miss a lot since i would like to do stuff like change the controls to my playstyle. This game's difficulty in the classic mode (At least for me) is not very hard at all, i would give it a "standart" or "slightly above average" in difficulty. This game promised me it would be a fun and fast-paced retro action game, so they gave me what they promised. I don't regret buying this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198802790807', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1683979126}
review:
FIFTY! That's it... That's the review!
Well jk! This game is a fast-paced challenging, yet simple arcade shooting game; All you have to do is deflect projectiles with your sword and shoot enemies back, or don't! As a friend once wrote in the review of "Vampire Survivors", sometimes beauty shines in simplicity, and this couldn't be any righter about Ubermosh! The combination of simple mechanics and challenging game-play results in an addictive game with high replayability value. 
Except for different classes and challenges, there isn't much to talk about when it comes to variety in this game; Random generated levels aren't that different and there isn't much variety and difference in enemy and weapons design. That said, considering the price of this game, Ubermosh is definitely worth it; It's  a pocket sized fun game that can entertain you for quite sometime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312153282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 334, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1683098494}
review:
In my opinion, I think Walter Machado should have taken all the eight Ubermosh games (including this one), and combined them into a single experience:

One game which includes all maps from the previous games, all modifiers, all modes, all saints, etc., and which also includes basic options found in other indie games such as [b]volume controllers[/b] for the game's music and sound effects, and the [b]ability to switch between windowed and full-screen mode[/b] using an in-game option (instead of having to rely on Alt + Enter).

Such a polished product [b]might[/b] be worth USD $5 at full price, and I would recommend you get such a product ONLY on sale. Unfortunately, that game - that "Ubermosh Definitive Edition" - will most likely never exist. Thus, I think I would only recommend you get any of the games in the Ubermosh series ONLY whenever they cost around $0.25 or less.

I do think they are decent twin-stick arcade bullet hell mini-games, after all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025573915', 'num_games_owned': 796, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1685139156}
review: Really fun and perfect for quick play sessions where you don't have a ton of time. I love playing this when I just want to get some action in but don't have a lot of time. Everything feels very polished and well done. With how complicated games can get, the simplicity of this one is frankly kind of refreshing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995683595', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1680481401}
review:
Ubermosh, a cheap game but almost nobody knows about, is unfortunate as a difficult game is largely unrecognized.
Ubermosh is a game with such a difficulty that you have to react quickly, this game put me to the test and today 03/31/23 I have completed the game and its achievements I feel satisfied with that.
I thank the creator Walter Machado for creating this arcade-style game that put me to the test with a total playing time of 2.7 hours and 100% completion.
I also hope to buy the entire Ubermosh saga and thus spend everything.

review: It's a pretty straightforward game, cut bullets, kill enemies, get the achievement and repeat. It's an easy, fast-paced, repetitive shooter game with a fun gameplay but that's all it has to offer. I extremely enjoyed it but sometimes the hitbox and aim was extremely wonky but nevertheless, was addicting.

author: {'steamid': '76561199224567549', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1676400003}
review:
ReseÃ±a hecha luego de haber terminado todos los Ubermosh Hasta el 8 y el SwarmRiders

La franquicia de ubermosh son juegos de acciÃ³n de tipo arcade con una especie de temÃ¡tica Cyberpunk Distopica que consisten en matar a las innumerables oleadas de enemigos que vienen hacia ti. 

Para llevar a cabo esta tarea te dan una espada con la que ademÃ¡s de obviamente poder atacar a melee puedes reflejar las balas que disparan tus enemigos y hacer que se maten con sus balas o las de sus compaÃ±eros, estos al morir te dropean un arma con la cual podrÃ¡s atacar a distancia dependiendo del rango del enemigo la calidad del arma varia. Mataras a cualquiera de tus enemigos de un simple disparo y ellos te mataran a ti tras 2-6 errores dependiendo de la clase del personaje que elijas y en esto radica todo el juego en acabar con la mayor cantidad de enemigos que te llegan desde todos los Ã¡ngulos posibles 

Es un juego como se puede suponer hasta cierto punto complicado, pero es cuestiÃ³n de hacerte con las mecÃ¡nicas que te ofrece el juego y te aseguro que no tendrÃ¡s problemas y podrÃ¡s sobrevivir a las oleadas sin ningÃºn impedimento despuÃ©s de aproximadamente una hora de juego 

Es una aventura muy frenÃ©tica que recomiendo si quieres un reto a un precio barato, pero tampoco recomiendo comprar la gran cantidad de juegos que ofrece la saga ya que no creo que valga la pena ya que sus nuevas entregas no ofrecen algo que realmente las diferencie del resto la mayor parte de las mejoras son agregar una clase nueva un enemigo nuevo o cualquier cambio mÃ­nimo para que diferencie, aunque sea un poco de la entrega anterior. Esto particularmente me frustro un poco ya que preferirÃ­a que el desarrollador hubiera sacado menos entregas con la intenciÃ³n de verdaderamente sacar una secuela que mejore este a su antecesor y no entregar el mismo juego con un cambio mÃ­nimo. Porque la saga sigue teniendo el mismo menÃº que no te da opciones de cambiar absolutamente nada de los settings del juego ni la resoluciÃ³n, ni un modo ventana o bajar la cantidad de partÃ­culas del juego ni siquiera puedes bajar la mÃºsica del juego que empieza a todo volumen. Desde la entrega 1 a la 8 siempre estas enfrentando a los mismos enemigos con el mismo diseÃ±o y en lugares muy parecidos vamos en la entrega 3/4 el cambio es que quitan todos los muros (que por cierto en la entregas 1/2 eran horribles por que no permitÃ­an moverte bien ya que te quedabas como pegado a ellos) incluso el juego estÃ¡ un poco mal optimizado vamos en un momento en la quinta entrega se me crasheaba el juego por tener muchas entidades en pantalla porque el juego cuanta las armas que sueltan los enemigos como una y no desaparecen  por lo tanto el juego ademÃ¡s de lagearte corres el riesgo de que se te crashee siendo un juego muy pobre incluso para los estÃ¡ndares de un juego pixel art 

Por esto dicho creo que vale la pena simplemente que juegues esta primera entrega te darÃ¡ 2/3 horitas de diversiÃ³n y un buen reto, pero no te recomiendo que juegues las siguientes entregas no te pierdes de nada es el mismo juego con unos pocos cambios.

review: An hour or two of fun, clearing out enemies and seeing how high of a score you can get. One big negative is that there's no windowed mode or a border to the game in general. Multiple screen set-up means your mouse will go off the main game screen and will result in you losing the game, since if you are tabbed out the game doesn't pause. Regardless of this, I would definitely recommend this game as it's 80 cents and you will definitely get some fun out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199167959534', 'num_games_owned': 1226, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1674671423}
review:
[i]"Ubermosh, the first installment in this indie retro arcade series is a game about ultra fast reactions using your sword to cut bullets and your gun to mow down opponents. Become a cyberpunk gladiator."[/i]

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

Gameplay is short and simple.  Try to survive by any means within 90 seconds.  One button will use your sword which you can deflect bullets back at attackers while the other button will use any gun you pick up from your fallen victims.  Each time you get hit it will use a life.  Once all your lives are gone your run ends and you receive a score.  Several different Badges are posted on the start screen to give you goals of attempting different things within your 90 seconds.  Gameplay is fast and fluid.  If you enjoy Score Attack games or games where you can challenge yourself to beat your old score using a different setup/build/modifications then I really think you'll have a fun time with this game.

[h1]Graphics/Art[/h1]

For a $1.00 USD game that is trying to nail the cyberpunk pixel aesthetic, I think the developer has done a wonderful job.  The artwork for the main character I believe will initially draw most people in and the gameplay will keep them playing.

[h1]Music/Sounds[/h1]

The music and sounds in this game are well above average for a low priced game of this type.  The sounds of your weapons feel impactful and powerful while the music gets you pumped to out score yourself.

[h1]Options/Settings[/h1]

I feel I have to mention this for some people.  This game has a home screen with every option available on it.  There is no options screen to go into to adjust things like resolution, volume, or turn things off like screen shake or vibration on controller.   Due to its 90 second loop I didn't find that any of that bothered me due to small game bouts however I thought some others might want to know.  If it indeed is somewhere in the game, I have no idea how to access it.

[h1]Other Modes/Things to do[/h1]

Aside from beating your score and trying to accomplish badges there are also Modifications you can place on your character.  They change things like only being able to have a sword, starting with the best guns, or only having guns all while modifying how many lives you have during a single battle.  This will allow you to change things up all while giving the game more replay value.

[h1]Bugs/Crashes/Compatibility Issues[/h1]

I experienced no issues with this game.  No crashes, no graphical glitches and nothing not responding, sounding or looking like it should.  It started up and closed down properly and without errors.

[h1]Closing Statement[/h1]

If you like fast reaction twitchy games that have an arcade feel that take place in short bouts you should try this game.  The concept for the game all goes together very well with gameplay and the gameplay is tight and fluid.  It is a simple game but works well and will definitely test your response and reaction time.  I look forward to returning to Ubermosh in the future.

[code]If you enjoyed this review and would like to see more detailed reviews by me please consider joining my curator page [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42726367-Gamer-Sessions/]Gamer Sessions[/url].[/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561199126589189', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1673897042}
review:
First time playing one of these Ubermosh games. This one is not that hard after you get a little used to the controls.
If you want to get 100% achievements just stay surrounded by walls and play Gunner mode, that's the easiest way

Also, don't even bother parrying projectiles, there's no actual reason to use the katana (another reason to play gunner), you never know when an enemy is gonna attack and the katana animation is not fast enough to keep parrying everything coming at you

Fun game tho...

author: {'steamid': '76561197987241968', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1673361750}
review:
The human psyche is a curious apparatus, the way it reacts to stimuli has always been a subject of paramount importance in the field of psychology. The average human being will usually react within a predetermined range to a multitude of stimuli or external pressures. This is not the case for the entity described as the "Ubermosh". He lives life on a knife's edge, where at any given moment his life my come to an abrupt and disastrous end for the sake of simply existing.

An endless cycle of brutality and violence. Each kill more gruesome than the last, the protagonist is seemingly driven by a morbid impulse. Not unlike an intoxicated adolescent, partaking in a frenzy of excessive drug abuse, who after a wild week of intoxication, comes to find their body and soul utterly dishevelled. The "Ubermosh" is often at odds with the forces of his oppressors, constantly beset upon by the waves of adversaries he faces. His psyche is not as feeble or easily damaged as a conventional human's. Instead, he possesses a robust and indomitable will that he uses to push through the perils he faces without faltering. His capacity to endure, suffer, and continue is unrivalled and is the reason why he survives

As he is confronted with each formidable adversary, it becomes clearer that his journey is not only that of a physical nature, as the opponents he faces are seemingly metaphorical, serving to symbolize his inner turmoil in the throes of an existential crisis. This theme of nihilism is prevalent throughout the entirety of the game. To survive this hellscape of a world, is to display a level of will that has not been seen for thousands of years. Only the legendary Greek Spartans have ever demonstrated a level of fortitude similar to the protagonist for he would rather die, his body battered and scarred from the wounds he sustained in his endless battles, than stop and give in to his oppressors.

The fact that the entity known simply as the "Ubermosh" exists and experiences the horrors of sentience is in and of itself a calamity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358245276', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1670362504}
review:
I don't have fun, it's just annoying.
Your only target in this game is making those achievements, otherwise gameplay is kinda repetitive.
I really understand the concept of difficult in games, but it's not that fun annoying mood, for example that game when you lose over and over again and say fuck I did a bad decision I need to get better having fun at the same time. 
I know it's a cheap game and things like that but I don't see an excuse for a game not having a setting button. (neither volume, neither camera settings)
I had to stop the music of the game in volume mixer on my computer.
Camera is too zoomed in and as I said above there's no settings.
I'd rather choose some settings instead of A.I anti camping when you literally got nothing to do because of the bad camera zooming.
A.I just come from anywhere and they are very difficult to avoid, you have to predict where the enemies are coming from and guess what, they randomly reach you in gangs of 20 and they just come into you without having any way to dodge at all. I'll still struggle myself to play and make all the achievements being on my way to complete 100% of many games until I hit myself like 30 times because of the frustration this game give me then I'll just come back on some little ponies games, that's all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001262462', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1667438089}
review:
Cons:
-Difficult learning curve that demands quick reflexes, patience + some luck.

Pros:
-Amazing soundtrack.
-Great simple visuals.
-Awesome character design, theme and art style.
-Good challenge for the player.
-Helps drain anger/rage/stress.
-Fast game play.
-Low price and generally has super discounts to buy the entire series (I bought this along with the whole series for 2 bucks)
-UBEEEERRRRRMMMMOOOSSSSHHHH!!!!

Other:
-Doesn't have that much content, but its what you get for the low price.

10/10, would UBERMOSH again.

review:
one of the best ways to kill 5 minutes is to play Ubermosh. it's a fast-paced action arcade game with banging tunes. with this game, every 15 minutes equates to about an hour of most other games of it's kind, like Hotline Miami or Katana Zero.
it's part of a series and i guess there's some sort of story but like... man i'm just here for gameplay. Kensai gang wya?

review:
Ubermosh primer juego de la saga segÃºn tengo entendido, es un infierno de balas, donde tendrÃ¡s que esquivar y hacer parria a balas para que no te impacten.

Es un juego desenfrenado, que en su tiempo le dedique dos horas y media, no consume requisitos segÃºn se, y es muy entretenido hasta que consigues el objetivo de sobrevivir 90 segundos en una arena de enemigos infinitos y segÃºn recuerdo puedes cambiar entre tu espada y recoger el arma de tus enemigos muerto dando te un buen grado de versatilidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989766649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1661840829}
review:
A fast, sleek and rudimentary bullet hell with a nice cyberpunk/40k-ish aesthetic. For its price point and the fact that it is the first in a series of games this is actually quite cool! Once you get the hang of the controls it is a fast paced dynamic action game with tons of flair. A huge bonus is the fact that you play as a totally badass Blade Saint (ergo a female space marine, Adepta Sororita in all but name) that cuts laserbullets back at her enemies! 

Recommended to fans of the genre!
The colony provides!

author: {'steamid': '76561199105751483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1692732260}
review: Also one of the worst games I have ever played. You die three times in 1 second. The walls in this game are bad too. If you are standing in front of the wall, you are not able to dodge the shots. The level is limited, so if you cross the line, you die. The handling from the game is just awful. For me it's impossible to get all achievments. All in all pure time and money waste.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354925299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1666682991}
review:
It's a classic arcade game. There are four character classes. [b] You cut bullets and shoot enemies [/b]. You get better gun drops from enemies. It gets so fast that you literally feel like you need inhumane levels of twitch reflexes although you can start making patterns in your head to keep clear as much area as possible at all times. It does get harder in some rounds while some allow more space for breathing. There is a Big-F-Gun in this game and I love it.

[i] A little warning [/i]- this game requires way more time and dedication [u] to complete[/u] than I imagined at first... You can't hop in and start playing... I think it has to be played consecutively... until you beat it. It reminds me of those old school games like [b] Contra [/b] and [b] Metal Slug [/b] but with more frames per second action LOL!

Tons of respect to the developer for adding their own music. It sounds fantastic. Gets in your head for good reasons!

I do wish there were more options in the settings, especially in sound but I am just nit-picking!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072761325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1682695343}
review:
You can consider this a review for the whole UBERMOSH series

First of all you'll notice quite a lot of UBERMOSH games and may be confused, each iteration of the series has small refinements and changes to make it just different enough from the last game, though let me be clear most of the changes are very minor. As the asking price is so low for each i find this ok, it's fun to play them back-to-back seeing the series evolve over time.

What you're looking at here is pure top down shooter gameplay with very little bells and whistles, despite the simplicity UBERMOSH oozes a unique style that really draws me in. What has been done here with what i guess is a very low budget is seriously impressive.

In terms of gameplay you can expect a hardcore top down shooter experience that throughout the series will expand with new classes and mechanics, the first game you'll start off lucky to kill enemies in the 100's, by the time you're at the last game you'll be slaughtering in the 1000's. 

Very simple but addictive gameplay that showcases some of the best examples of what talented indie devs can do with a low budget but obvious passion for the craft. Highly recommended for any topdown shooter fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004546096', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 285, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1656018506}
review:
The camera is so insanely zoomed in that the whole challenge and difficulty of the game is basically enemies coming from below and above the screen since they shoot you before you can even see them. Beyond frustrating.

The winning strategy is to find walls that partially cover top and bottom of your screen and just camp that spot for 90 seconds. Since the primitive map layout is not procedurally generated you just find 1-2 of such spots and well yeah that's the game, bout three minutes worth of content + half an hour to grind achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121528252', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1654134039}
review: Bought and completed this in 4 hours, but anyone with quicker reflexes and lots of experience with bullet-hells such as this could realistically complete all the achievements in about 20-30 minutes, barring awful rng of course. It's intense, the soundtrack is perfect for the gameplay, there's the god gun that is literally the only gun worth using and going Kensai is a one-way ticket to insanity, especially if you intend on trying to get the 150-kill achievement for it. It's a nice, tightly packed little game that's good for an adrenaline rush or two, just don't look at the timer and you'll be fine.

review:
Difficult but fun game! i'm currently trying to 100% all of Walter Machado's games, fun challenge for sure. I haven't played any of the other UBERMOSH games yet but after 100% this one and rocking out to the music i can't wait to try the others. 

my only real complaint is after playing the tendons in my hand hurt and my blood pressure feels high, if you want a game like that for cheep can't go wrong with this one!

NÃ£o Ã© uma sensaÃ§Ã£o qualquer, porque ele te lembra os jogos antigos de fliperama onde vocÃª saia de casa e tinha aqueles jogos bem retro com fichas. E portar isso pra computadores atuais (qualquer batata roda nele) foi bem nostalgica, ainda mais eu que tive pouco contato com jogos deste tipo. Ã‰ um jogo suave, Ã© desafiador (conquistas sÃ£o nostalgicas tambem), trabalha bastante com reflexo e a sua trilha sonora Ã© muito boa.

E vamos lembrar que este jogo foi feito por um brasileiro! Que trabalho incrivel, um jogo simples que Ã© desafiador e divertido. SÃ³ de olhar pelas prints e trailer ja diz exatamente tudo de como Ã© o jogo. NÃ£o vi nenhum bug e tambÃ©m Ã© muito difÃ­cil de vocÃª encontrar maneiras de burlar IA, entÃ£o Ã© basicamente "DÃ¡ o seu jeito ai".

UBERMOSH Ã© o tipico jogo que vocÃª estÃ¡ entediado e quer matar um pouco de tempo, alÃ©m disso, quem gosta de desafio vai passar tempinho nele... haha. Para mim, valeu cada centavo, recomendadissimo comprar em promoÃ§Ã£o.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027846232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1643407323}
review:
The gameplay and lore are straight-forward: you come in and have to kill everything that moves to survive for 90 seconds max. In that period of time - if you'll survive that long - you can take as much ugly alien entities with you to your untimely death. Either with your sword or a small variety of weaponry. It's a sci-fi gladiator arena. 

That's simply why you're there and it's oddly satisfying. Die, respawn, go, repeat.

The entire collection just for the cost of a beer.

There is not much to it but the gameplay is fun and challenging.

I usually use Ubermosh to bridge time-gaps since it takes so little time per game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167079222', 'num_games_owned': 2548, 'num_reviews': 590, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1654116985}
review:
[h1] Wish there was a "middle" option. [/h1]

I love this game and it can be very fun and challenging, unfortunately the developers made the game a terrible quality. This is acceptable for the 1990s, not decades later.

Pros :
+ Fun and challenging gameplay
+ Lots of replay ability
+ Trading cards
+ Achievements
+ Reasonable price on sale

Cons :
- Terrible graphics
- Can get annoying and too frustrating

4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198330888468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 507, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1631674530}
review:
Not gonna lie, i really am bad at this game, but that doesn't stop it from being stylish and fun. 
It is an easy thumbs up, and I will keep plugging away trying to get better.
The core game play is pretty basic, top down view, you are moving around an arena, and people are trying to shoot you. Right mouse splits bullets and bounces them back. If you kill someone, they drop a gun, and you can shoot, but you retain your bullet splitting sword. 
It also accepts input from a controller.
The music, kind of a throbbing techno beat, is pretty good too. I picked up the soundtrack with the bundle, and it is a decent listen.

MÃºsica decente y con una jugabilidad parecida al Nuclear Throne aunque no es por "pisos" como un roguelike, simplemente matar todos los bichos que puedas en 90 segundos o hasta morir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1630133066}
review:
"UBERMOSH" ist ein Arcade Top-Down Twin-Stick Shooter.

"UBERMOSH" ist direkt.
"UBERMOSH" ist stylisch.
"UBERMOSH" ist unbarmherzig.

Wir sind in eine KÃ¤mpferin mit einem Neon-Schwert. In der Arena, in der wir uns wiederfinden versucht eine Masse an Gegnern uns zu vernichten. Mit unserem Schwert kÃ¶nnen wir nicht nur Gegner schnetzeln, sondern auch ankommende Neon-Laser schneiden und zurÃ¼ckwerfen. Wir kÃ¶nnen Waffen von Gegnern aufnehmen und haben dann neben unserem Schwert auch eine Feuerwaffe.

Und das ist dann eigentlich auch schon das ganze Spiel. Mehr gibts nicht. Kein Aufwerten, keine Aufgaben, keine nennenswerte Geschichten. Einfach nur 90 Sekunden gegen Gegnerhorden Ã¼berleben. Das Einzige, was wir wÃ¤hlen kÃ¶nnen, sind verschiedene Startbedingungen. So haben wir zum Beispiel im Kensai-Modus zwar zwei Leben mehr, kÃ¶nnen aber nur das Schwert und keine SchuÃŸwaffen verwenden. Das klingt konzeptuell nicht nur simpel, es ist konzeptuell auch simpel. Aber trotzdem oder vielleicht deswegen macht es eine Menge SpaÃŸ.

"UBERMOSH" ist genau das richtige Spielchen, wenn man mal fÃ¼nf Minuten Ã¼berbrÃ¼cken will. Schnell, unkompliziert, unterhaltsam. Mechanisch funktioniert der Titel sauber und direkt.

Ã„sthetisch bewegen wir uns auf pixeligem Cyberpunk Neon Niveau. Und das paÃŸt erstaunlich gut zum Spielprinzip.

Ein nicht unwesentlicher Teil zum Spielerlebnis trÃ¤gt auch der richtig starke Instrumental-Soundtrack bei. Jedes StÃ¼ck schiebt extrem an, entweder durch einen treibenden Rhythmus oder eine aggressive E-Guitarre.

"Ubermosh" ist das Gegenteil von abendfÃ¼llend. 
"Ubermosh" ist die Reduktion auf das absolut Notwendige.
"Ubermosh" ist "Ubermosh" 


[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
8/10 AtmosphÃ¤re
3/10 Story
7/10 Grafik
9/10 Sound
7/10 Spielmechanik
6/10 Balancing
7/10 Spielspass 

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
In der Zeit, die Du diese Rezension gelesen hast, hÃ¤ttest Du auch leicht drei Partien "Ubermosh" zocken kÃ¶nnen.

[h1][b]7/10 Gesamtwertung

review: Gameplay is fun and very addictive. A bit difficult, but didn't make me rage (which is a rare thing). In fact, it's strangely relaxing. I needed that. Can't wait to play the next installments in this series. I recommend using mouse and keyboard over gamepad. Only bad thing here is that the movement controls sometimes (very rarely) feel unresponsive / delayed but maybe it's just me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001046455', 'num_games_owned': 13201, 'num_reviews': 349, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1624142886}
review:
[h1]A hectic arcade score-attack top-down shooter/slasher. (The tags are getting wild!)[/h1]

A cool concept executed magnificently, [i]UBERMOSH[/i] gives you a sword and drops you into a pit of nasty people with guns.

Fortunately, you can reflect the bullets with the sword and steal their guns!

[h1]Lightning reactions wanted[/h1]

Enemies keep coming from all directions. The goal is to both survive for 90 seconds and rack a highscore of KOs. Death comes after a few hits, while the opponents die of a single hit.

Controls are simple: WASD for movement, cursor for targeting, left-click for shooting, and right-click for swordplay. There's also a gamepad option for the twin-stick afficionados out there.

The screen is zoomed quite close, thus you have about half a second to react before they are over you and shooting at your face. A bit annoyingly, this means that it's harder to see what's on the top and bottom of the screen than sideways.

[h1]Toys and variety[/h1]

There's several guns, with different shooting patterns, all of which are available to your opponents ([i]and[/i] dropped by them when they die).

You can also choose a harder difficulty mode with more enemies, and switch between several character class mods, changing the gameplay slightly. Each class comes with an achievement for a highscore.

[h1]Technical comments[/h1]

For a game called [i]UBERMOSH[/i], the metal music is a great fit and of good quality.

Note though that the settings are non-existent. I was unable to find a way to adjust sound and music volume or the resolution options.

Playing in fullscreen with two monitors, I occasionally had the trouble that the mouse cursor would wander into the other monitor and I'd lose focus when accidentally clicking outside (resulting in almost certain death). It's a minor complaint but it would have been useful if the cursor was fixated on the game window.

Also, there's no pause - you got to play the 90 seconds to their fullest or retry later.

[h1]Quick and fun[/h1]

Highscore runners will have fun breaking their records (even though there are no Steam Leaderboards), but players with quick reflexes will complete the game's content fast. Personally, I only took about 45 minutes to 100% achievements.

It's worth its $1 price tag but regardless of that, it is frequently on deep sale. You can even grab the whole collection of [i]UBERMOSH[/i] games (currently 8 titles) for less than $2. The other titles in the series bring slight twists to the concept, so be sure to check those out if you liked [i]UBERMOSH[/i].

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/9997062/]~Twistorian Curator~[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198066983814', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1496105222}
review:
Dev is an absolute chad. Every once and while for the past couple of years I find a new UBERMOSH game in my steam library every since I bought the first one- FOR FREE!
I know that all UBERMOSH games are essentially the same but each one builds on the formula and adds more mayhem than the last. 
Walter Machado, thanks for sneaking all those UBERMOSH games in my collection. I've enjoyed immensely.  Keep up the great work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075324976', 'num_games_owned': 909, 'num_reviews': 689, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1620503573}
review:
The short version: This is fun for the price, but you are getting what you pay for at $1 or less. Don't expect much more than that.
---
Note: There's currently 8 games in the Ubermosh series and since they all share enough in common with each other, I'm writing one review for the series and then copy & pasting it to all of them.
---

What it is:
A pixel art combat arena with rogue-like arcade design and a focus on a simple combat gimmick that is easy to learn but difficult to master. Each replay is expected to be just a few minutes long, die and repeat. Taken for what it is, this is a few fast paced minutes of fun that you can pick up and play as a break.

The story (not that it needs one) is a simple excuse for the action: the real world is peaceful but humans need violence and created the uber-mosh-pit so they can exercise their violent tendencies. You are teleported in, given a sword that can knock back bullets and let loose in an arena of death and carnage. Slice and shoot your way through waves of cloned minion-enemies in a bullet hell until you take enough damage and get teleported out. Like a classic arcade game your only real goal here is to get a higher score each time.

For a bit of variety there are different classes to pick from, some focus more on guns or the sword and each has a different number of respawns before your run is ended. There's a list of challenges to complete to obtain the achievements, the majority of which are kill/score X number with Y class.

It's as simple and straight forward as it sounds, but its also just cathartic action fun and if you're into that old-school action mentality the achievements can be quite a challenge to earn.

That basic design is present in every game in the series.
---

What each new game does: is evolve the formula just slightly. Each has a slightly different arena / playing area. Some add additional classes for more style choices. Sometimes new enemies along with the old ones. What the developer did was after making the original template he listened to fans and created a new variant each time based on their feedback and requests.

In many ways if this were a bigger more expensive game each of them could have just been one level and kept updating one game. Instead he kept it simple and cheap and each $1 game is a variation and evolution of the previous one. It's an unusual design choice, but at this cheap a price it's not a deal breaker. If you're unsure that this style is for you, buy one of them for under $1. Otherwise you can typically get all of them in a bundle for less than the price of a larger game anyway.

You could easily get a few hours out of each trying to complete the challenges for the achievements, chipping away with just a few minutes of cathartic violence at a time.
---

If you are wondering about the order, it's by release date and he just chose to name the even ones and number the odd ones. While the core gameplay is the same in each, I do suggest starting from the beginning as you'll better appreciate the minor changes to each as it evolves from one to the next.

Ubermosh
Ubermosh: Black
Ubermosh Vol 3
Ubermosh: Wraith
Ubermosh Vol 5
Ubermosh: Sancticide
Ubermosh Vol 7
Ubermosh: Omega
---

author: {'steamid': '76561198336441212', 'num_games_owned': 655, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1613129267}
review: Great fun, but lasts only for short time, even considering 100% achievements. The achievements are well earned (especially Kensai mastery). Once you're done with the normal mode and achievements, hardboiled mode dials the action up a notch. It's a shame that there are no achievements associated with the new mode, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119681233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1612950028}
review: Fun, challenging top-down shooter with an arcade feel and a little twist - you can deflect bullets with your sword and the map is randomly generated every round. The game speeds up rather quickly throughout each round. The achievements are difficult enough to require effort but within reason enough to stay fun. Very fun game, definitely worth the nearly free price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979892505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1631998831}
review:
I don't know if there needs to be like 7 of these, but this game is fucking great.

You're bored, I'm bored, let's go shoot and slash each other to near death.

Shoot guns, swipe sword, deflect bullets, rack up score, try to last 90 seconds. Easy peasy (oh god it's not).

Goes on sale for like $.49.

author: {'steamid': '76561199088965886', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1613485574}

author: {'steamid': '76561198089722308', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1611987337}
review: I really like this game because it reminds me of all the flash games i played on stickpage.com. They're simple, but really violent and fun. Plus this game un-ironically has one of my favorite soundtracks in any game ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979830493', 'num_games_owned': 1264, 'num_reviews': 326, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1611882130}
review:
Fun, simple, and short romp around with guns and aliens. There's not much content to be had here, but for a $0.50 cent pickup - this makes for a fun and fast break from work without tying me down with a story, save games, or other stuff.

Also, the guns feel *great* with the screen shake when shooting. They all feel so strong and powerful. Fantastic audio and music to match.

I'd say this is a win for the price. Good stuff! I recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998280696', 'num_games_owned': 3109, 'num_reviews': 606, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1609554928}
review:
O primeiro jogo da sÃ©rie de jogos de UBERMOSH do desenvolvedor brasileiro Walter Machado. 

O jogador tem 90 segundos para sobreviver e fazer seu placar de inimigos mortos usando arma de fogo e/ou uma espada que corta balas, dependendo da classe que escolher para a fase. Com dois modos de dificuldade, clÃ¡ssico e hardboiled, em que na mais difÃ­cil aparecem mais inimigos. NÃ£o hÃ¡ histÃ³ria no jogo. Mesmo assim, conseguiu ser um tÃ­tulo independente de sucesso pelos elementos de arcade e sua trilha sonora robÃ³tica e com sons pesados que combina bem com o estilo ciberpunk. As conquistas destacadas na tela inicial sÃ£o bons desafios para algumas horas.

O que nÃ£o achei legal foi restringir o tiro automÃ¡tico para uma classe porque sÃ£o muitos inimigos e ficar clicando para cada tiro cansou minha mÃ£o. Sendo um desenvolvedor brasileiro, tambÃ©m poderia ter investido na traduÃ§Ã£o para nossa lÃ­ngua e seria pouco, pois sÃ£o pequenos textos e Ã¡udios.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304032088', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1609197483}
review:
Tras completar Ubermosh al 100% (Con esto me refiero a todos los logros que hay a lo largo del juego) y conseguir +300 puntos tanto en el modo Normal como en el Hardboiled en cada clase, puedo confirmar que [b]Ubermosh[/b] es un juego que vale su precio en oro, y no me importarÃ­a haber pagado 5â‚¬ en vez de 0.39â‚¬.

Hablemos de jugabilidad, la cual es un point and click de toda la vida, te mueves con wasd, con click izquierdo disparas (si llevas arma) y con el botÃ³n derecho usas tu espada, la cual, y he aquÃ­ una de las mecÃ¡nicas principales del juego, desvÃ­a proyectiles enemigos hacia el lado del que provienen, a veces dividiendo el proyectil en mitades o tercios.
AÃºn parecer sencillo de manejar, [b]Ubermosh[/b] ofrece una maravillosa dificultad y una mecÃ¡nica la cual te dejarÃ¡ las manos cansadas, y que resulta HORRIBLEMENTE DIFÃCIL dominar, eso sin tener en cuenta que el juego posee 4, asÃ­ es, CUATRO variantes de clase que te cambian el nÃºmero de veces que pueden darte, quÃ© armas puedes usar y cÃ³mo, o simplemente revocando el acceso a estas.
GrÃ¡ficos excelentes, con una estÃ©tica que no me ha aburrido casi en absoluto, y que cuando llevas una buena pila de puntos, dejas una pantalla llena de colores y armas.

90 segundos, pero vivx vas a aguantar 10.
[b]Ubermosh[/b]

review: You move your mouse around and click to shoot, but the game doesn't lock the mouse to the window, so expect to click out of the window randomly a lot. That doesn't pause the game either, so that'll ruin your run. There's no independent sound or music volume controls, in fact there are no volume controls whatsoever. Actually... there's no settings at all, of any kind. I think instead of making 7 odd 'volumes' of this game, the dev should've spent all that time making one volume to an acceptable degree of quality. This is just unfun shovelware trash. :(

If you have that small amount of money on your account then i recommend buying this game. Its entertaining and fun to play. In game you have classes but you can play without any of them. Anyway its best to spam with your weapon if you want to easy win but melee weapon is good in some moments too, it can "cut" bullets but its not really cutting bullets you deflect them into your enemies protecting yourself from them but playing only melee is really hard. Just gonna say, its worth buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036538203', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1608696033}
review:
I'm in the middle of pulling an all-nighter in the hope of resetting my sleep schedule this upcoming night. A perfect opportunity to review this pulse-pounder.

"Plot" and universe is rather simple, all in the narration you hear in the trailer, and again in the tutorial: You play as a human(oid) woman in a futuristic space colony. It's got you covered for much you'd want and/or need, except a good fight, so the girl comes to the deserts to get her fix. You help her fight.

If it turns out Walter Machado has written up much else for this game, I wouldn't know it. Which is well indeed anyway, as this game is about action. And boy howdy does it deliver.


Various aspects of the game control are in and of themselves satisfying, and together allow you great control of the protagonist in question. Walking speed, responsiveness of the attack buttons, the aiming reticule; all come together to give a great sense of control and even power.

That control and power will be needed against the hordes that come. They too benefit from walking speed and shot aiming. The enemies come fast and hard enough that introduction leads to warm-up, which leads to test, which leads to challenge, which leads to the fight of this girl's life- or it would be if she didn't canonically teleport back to the colony for medicine.

This being said, the shots are slow enough, and there's enough space to move around, that it really feels like this is a game you can win, if you react and adapt quickly and accurately enough.

In the innumerable times I have let the poor purple thrill-seeker get hospitalized, it seemed most of the times in retrospect to have been preventable.

Effects come to mind and also need to be mentioned. The sound and visual effects of weapons, bodies and fluid pools left by defeated enemies, particles from attacks, and in particular screen shakes from powerful weapons, each compound on the gameplay to make in my opinion a very visceral experience.

Amid all this, I must remind that a chief aspect of the game is its brevity. The game loads fast, rounds start fast, and the rounds last only seconds or maybe a minute or two.  Ubermosh is a game to play in moments you want a gaming fix yet are short on time.

I have absolutely made *no* progress in this game, at all, and I have not so much as even acquired a single Steam Achievement - and I *still* recommend it for any thrill-seekers out there, especially ones who want a reliable quick-fix while waiting for an Uber (nerk-nerk) to work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028119565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1611471259}
review: Really good little game. Simple concept but lots of fun to be had. If you are looking for a fast paced casual game then this is for you. You can play for a few minutes or a few hours depending on what your have on. Only downside I can find is that it is only able to play it in windowed mode which is alright if you have a single monitor but if your running a duel setup like myself you'll find that when you get into it and you happen to throw the mouse around you can go from the best kill streak of you life to your desktop in zero seconds flat. It can put a real dampener on your fun. As yet I haven't found a way to make it a full screen game that locks your mouse to the this game and this game only. I highly recommend if your looking for a quick bit of fun that you can keep going back to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103887886', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1649502789}
review:
[h1] THE COLONY PROVIDES US EVERYTHING... EXCEPT FOR VIOLENCE [/h1]
UBERMOSH is a simple top-down shoot'em up game, set in a unique universe of distant desert arena-planet of Ultracaar. Our main character, a woman called Blade Saint, is here to slaughter and fight for eternity with wild and violent creatures of Swarm. This eternal fight will bring joy to people of Colony and will make her seek for more death and glory on the blood-soaked deserts of the planet. That is the sport called UBERMOSH.
Like I said above, the game is simple... But not easy! You have to choose one of four classes and kill as many enemies as possible in 90 seconds. The terrain is randomly generated, but It really doesn't change anything. What matters is the enemies themselves. They WILL swarm around you. And each one of them have guns. Prepare to dodge or slice a lot of shÑ–t on your way.
Also, game has a really great and unique soundtrack, that sounds like a wild mix of DnB and brutal guitar metal.
Game is cheap af and it totally worth it. It's an awesome action game that will make your blood boil and beg for more.
[spoiler] FIGHT. DIE. RESPAWN. AGAIN. LET THE SLAUGHTER CONTINUE! [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198058635054', 'num_games_owned': 2629, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1594601006}
review: For a 90 second jolt of adrenaline look no further. Simple but challenging pulse pounding music fueled pixel mayhem. I only wish the spine-tingling announcer's voice pervaded every level. For 50 cents it's a satisfying time waster. The amazing soundtrack alone is reason enough to buy!

review:
[b]Ubermosh[/b] ist [b]potthÃ¤sslich, unfair, demotivierend und perfekt[/b] zu steuern.

Kurzum: Der Entwickler wusste exakt was er tat und hat hier nichts anderes, als einen erhobenen Mittelfinger in das Gesicht jedes Casualgamers abgeliefert.

Auch, wenn sich das Spiel im allgemeinen nicht empfehlen lÃ¤sst, muss bei aller Kritik eines zugegeben werden: Das Spiel wirkt wie aus einem Guss. Wer es spielen und meistern will, muss sich komplett darauf einlassen.


Allein aufgrund dieser Tatsache wird die [b]Ubermosh[/b]-Reihe seine Fangemeinde behalten und weiter ausbauen kÃ¶nnen.

Die meisten Spieler werden aber definitiv vom unbarmherzigen Spieldesign dieses Highscoreshooters sofort abgeschreckt sein.

[b]Pro:[/b]
- fetziger Soundtrack

[b]Contra:[/b]
- demotivierendes Spieldesign
- hÃ¤ssliche Grafik


[b]UBERMOSH:[/b] Ein hÃ¤ssliches & demotivierendes Entlein mit geilem Soundtrack !
[b]Wertung:[/b]
[b]4 / 10[/b] Punkte

review:
Un bullet hell del demonio. MorirÃ¡s. VolverÃ¡s a morir. ReintÃ©ntalo otra vez. Vuelve a morir...

Ubermosh es un juego muy adictivo al que no podrÃ¡s jugar 1 sola partida. 

Las partidas son muy rÃ¡pidas y estÃ¡n acompaÃ±adas por una gran banda sonora que no hace mÃ¡s que meterte mÃ¡s en el juego y elevar el ritmo frenÃ©tico de la partida.

Recomiendo toda la saga aunque realmente es el mismo juego pero con alguna pistola, presentaciÃ³n o personaje nuevo pero vamos... la diferencia es mÃ­nima entre todos ellos.

SÃ­n duda es un juego que comprado en oferta merece mucho la pena. Un "must have" para mi gusto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065651270', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1593441627}
review:
Fun as fuck! And only $0.99, $0.49 on sale! I'd pay $5 for this one, totally worth picking up, it's practically free, it's an absolute blast, and it's got a bangin' soundtrack.

my only critique is that there's no option to skip the "tutorial" at the beginning with no class mods, it takes me longer to get back into the action after dying so often. I guess I just have to get better at the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1586788703}
review:
This is the first of a series of retro pixel top down twin stick survival shooters where you must survive as long as you can against waves of enemies. The twists with this one are that you can attack the bullets with your little sword. Great.

This is utterly derivative and it seems the developer is hell bent on just reskinning and re-releasing the same game direct to bundles and shovelware bins to see how much money he can gouge from Steams lack of quality control.

Reasons not to buy this? Nearly no game at all, just the tired shooter survival mechanic seen in hundreds of other games. Fixed resolution, fixed controls, terrible retro pixel graphics from an extremely lazy developer. At least the price is proportional to the quality here... extremely low. And yet it still feels overpriced.

author: {'steamid': '76561198882781495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1584905604}
review: UBERMOSH is a fun, fast-paced, simple yet addicting game. You have 90 seconds to kill as many as possible. The gameplay is solid and the gun mechanics work great. The soundtrack is awesome! I purchased this game with no expectations and now I want to try the rest of the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131782553', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1602277465}
review:
UBERMOSH is an adrenaline-fueled pit of violence.
Simple, addictive and challenging gameplay.
Banging tunes.
Cool aesthetic.

It's pure arcade fun.... And it's only a buck.

Jump in the pit and start moshing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198268400506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1583997537}
review: Really fun and surprisingly addictive 2d arena shooter/slasher. Sort of similar to hotline miami, but definitely different. There is a very nice learning curve, at the beginning you're like, 'I'm supposed to get 150 kills with just the blade?!' but once you get the fundamentals you'll progress really quick and the gameplay gets wild. It's essentially shooting and learning to parry shots. The art style is really cool and the metal soundtrack goes with the gameplay very well. Took about 3 hours to 100%, but there is definitely a lot of replayability. Absolutely gonna check out the rest of the UBERMOSH series!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019159426', 'num_games_owned': 1871, 'num_reviews': 433, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1579823751}
review:
Fast paced, one shot death. One melee or bullet will kill you. Ubermosh. It's right click to slash your blade - extremely quickly. Your sword is like a light saber, you reflect bullets/ projectiles,and pick up guns for left mouse button shoot. 
WASD to move. 

But you need to pay attention to where you run, and what you pick up. The bigger the enemy, the bigger the gun. 

Very cool game. Simple but effective graphics. Nothing glitching or lagging, the game is go, choose between multiple modes, etc. settings are simple.

The game is a form of mastery. There are also many other version of Ubermosh, which makes this only the foundation. The learning point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198869789048', 'num_games_owned': 1760, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1578433443}
review: I played the Ubermosh series in reverse and might see things with different eyes. The first entry in the series is quite dated and does not really life up to the frenetic experience of Ubermosh Vol.3+. Vol.1 is even more hampered by its very limited field of view, bad collision detection, rage inducing sticky-walls, and it does not feature the an open/infinite battle field (and none of the fancy abilities that have been added to later titles) I think, Vol.1 can be safely omitted. However, you can get it very cheap, has trading cars (probably the most boring of any game), and you can get 7 achievements in less than 2 hours. Plus, the game does not suffer the same performance issues I experienced with Vol.2 (Black was almost unplayable on my machine) to 4, and to some degree with 5 as well. (I think Vol. 6 shows the best performance if you have toaster). What's missing (in most titles up to Vol.6): Grafics/Audio/Controller options (why is the most annoying controller rumbling turned on per default on?! To teach how to turn it off in Big Screen?) Welp, acceptable. 4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197986611030', 'num_games_owned': 2849, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1521247974}
review:
[h1]Some games you are just painfully hard, such is [b]Ubermosh[/b], and it's set to a metal soundtrack.[/h1]This cyberpunk, bullet hell / twin stick shooter, features procedural generation of levels, and some high paced action with swordplay and/or laser guns depending on class mods. 
[list]
    [*] Highscores.
    [*] Small amount of achievements, well earned.
    [*] Steam Trading cards
    [*] Sequels that get harder.
    [*] A prequel that is on a motorbike.
[/list]

review: The only genuine issues I have with this game are just because I need to get better, and that's not a complaint at all! It's a great game with challenging gameplay, and the different modes help keep the gameplay fresh if you're feeling a bit bored of playing a certain way. Definitely gonna be grinding for high scores again once I build a pc

author: {'steamid': '76561198257289082', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1710090281}
review:
This game. Oh. My god. I purchased this and the soundtrack on sale for $.65 cents and I honestly wish I had payed full price for this game and it's soundtrack.
Its fast paced and action packed, so much fun in such a small bursts. I find I'm always on the edge of my seat playing this. This is a new kind of bullet hell and it's amazing. Plus, the soundtrack is awesome and fits the game so well.
Welcome to Ubermosh.

review: Hmmm... naja, fÃ¼r die paar Cent die ich bezahlt habe sicherlich kein Fehlkauf, aber dieses Spiel ist nun wirklich keine Offenbarung. Mich stÃ¶rt hier fast alles. Der Charakter schlittert immer ein StÃ¼ck weiter durch die Gegend nachdem man sich bewegt hat. Hinzu kommt ein unfassbar nerviges Gewackel des gesamten Bildschirms wenn man schieÃŸt oder getroffen wird. Wird man getroffen gibt es keinen Cooldown, das heiÃŸt man kann quasi in weniger als einer Sekunde sterben wenn mehrere Gegner einen beschieÃŸen. AuÃŸerdem ist die Sichtweite ein Witz. Die Bewegungen der Gegner sind nicht nachvollziehbar. Zudem dauert es nach dem Ableben ein paar Sekunden bevor man neustarten kann. Das nervt! Die Musik ist leider sehr stÃ¶rend und nervt ebenfalls schon nach wenigen Minuten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173899526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1663534916}
review:
Ubermosh is a wonderful series of frantic top-down shooters.

There is no campaign, and the game is all about scoring as many kills as possible within 90 seconds. You start off with a melee weapon which can cut enemies and deflect their shots, and have to quickly grab a weapon to start shooting at them. At some point, elite enemies start spawning and drop a better gun that will drastically increase your score when you manage to pick it up.

Enemies are spawning non-stop and attack you from every direction. The game is going to test your reflexes, as the action is really fast and the slightest misstep can get you killed, and it's all about quickly reacting to unexpected situations, assessing whether it's best to shoot enemies or to swing your sword a few times to reposition yourself.

They're all excellent games to unwind, and it's really rewarding to seek high scores if you like the good old arcade feeling. By the way, the dev is really cool and committed to development and taking account of community feedback. Definitely recommended.

I'd say this one is good to pick up if you took interest in the series and want to see if it really catches your breath, as it is the first installment, and already a pretty solid standalone, while sticking to the mere basics.
Every following title adds something to the gameplay. I've reviewed them all, feel free to check them if you're curious !

author: {'steamid': '76561198073504340', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1587831963}
review:
Ubermosh, the dad of the series. Very solid entry. Super stylish, super hard, super metal. I love it but it has its problems which later titles correct to a certain extent. If you like any of the Ubermosh entries you should play this one.  If you like solid 2D-Arcade-Shooting you should try this one.

If you want a full breakdown of the Walter-Collection, here you go: https://youtu.be/rFn2ZeVd6ZU

review:

El juego es arcade y con buena mÃºsica, pero me gustarÃ­a que hubiera mÃ¡s variedad de canciones. A diferencia de otros juegos arcade, sientes progresiÃ³n y tienes distintas dificultades y variaciones, asÃ­ que no te cansarÃ¡s rÃ¡pido.

En cuanto al gameplay, es igual o muy similar en todos los juegos UBERMOSH, pero recomendarÃ­a pillarse el Ãºltimo, ya que incluye nuevas armas y enemigos, asÃ­ como un mapa diferente con obstÃ¡culos.

Si halamos de la rejugabilidad, el juego es perfectamente rejugable para entre 1 y 5 horas, y creo que aÃ±adir niveles, ademÃ¡s de la dificultad del juego, lo harÃ­a aÃºn mejor.

En definitiva, es un buen juego y creo que podrÃ­a valer la pena hasta por 3â‚¬, pero conseguÃ­ el pack "The UBERMOSH Collection" en descuento, asÃ­ que me acabÃ³ costando menos y definitivamente me ha valido la pena.

review:
The Original UBERMOSH

Comes together with the awesome UBERMOSH OST DLC
Although not as well rounded as more recent installments, this is still an awesome game, which every UBERMOSHer should own.
It's not as intense as parts 5-7, but it brings it's very own challenge and charm. No fan of metal and frantic slaughter should miss it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042075167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1528014822}
review:
Okay, firstly, I should say that I am NOT very good at this game, so I'm not entirely sure if I've seen all it has to offer. It doesn't seem like there's much, if anything, to unlock, and all I'm really missing is harder difficulty of play, but what I have experienced is pure, distilled gaming adrenaline. 

If you love that feeling of running around to badass music, taking on the forces of hell, in Doom, Ubermosh might be a great fit for a specific situation. Don't have the time for a whole Doom level, for whatever reason? Wanna get your reactions primed before playing something else? Ubermosh might be perfect for you. 

It doesn't feel like there's much more there, with Ubermosh, but there really doesn't have to be, even if there isn't. The gameplay is addictive and frenetic, the music gives you caffeine twitches, and the price seems perfect, especially when it's on sale. If the game were two to five dollars, I doubt I'd have bought it, but it probably would've been worth that for me, just for the gameplay I've already gotten out of it, and the specific niche it filled and will continue to fill.

I haven't played any of the other Ubermosh games, but if they don't add anything significant, as another review seemed to suggest, then I'm fine with just this one version, and won't be buying any more. I do find this worrying, if true, but I'll save judgement for those that have compared them. (hence this still being a positive review)

author: {'steamid': '76561198082552419', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1561217052}
review:
Basically a tech demo driven by achievements. It'd be a great game somewhere between pong and donkey kong. For a game released after 1980 it lacks... game. People say it's great because of the price. No it isn't. There's plenty better free web games, even you do not care about your time.

Pros: 
* easy to 100% complete (~5 hours or so without going to the forums and finding your own strats)
* very cheap
* music is OK and graphics are readable

Cons:
* no game
* no balance
* it gets boring way before you complete it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079024378', 'num_games_owned': 1706, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1560859412}
review:
A great score chaser

The Good:
- Nice art style.
- Good Music.
- Gameplay is simple but addictive.

The Okay:
- It's short. I got all the achievements in 77 minutes.
- I didn't expect to get much for 39 cents, but some customization options would've been nice.

The Bad:
- There's no options menu whatsoever. You can't change the resolution, mute the music, change controls or anything at all.
- It appears to be locked at 60FPS.

review:
[h1]Summary:[/h1]	[i](longer version below)[/i]
For the price it is a decent quick-paced shoot'n'slash, especially for those that like to 100% games.

[h1]In-Depth:[/h1]
Ubermosh is an extremely simple game that essentially turns into a bullet hell with a wicked soundtrack. Overall it was really short and at times very frustrating.

The achievements were fair and simple enough to earn so it made up for the lack of replayability, plus it's very often on a big sale.
