review:
[h1] Morra, Viva, Repita. [/h1] 
UBERMOSH Ã© um jogo brasileiro, simples com um estilo retrÃ´ e de aÃ§Ã£o frenÃ©tica com uma trilha sonora que acompanha em suas batalhas. Com 4 estilos de jogo em que vocÃª terÃ¡ 90 segundos de puro Ãªxtase para trucidar seus inimigos. NÃ£o pense que eles facilitaram a sua vida, porque vocÃª poderÃ¡ morrer num piscar de olhos. Sendo um estilo de jogo em que vocÃª passa horas tentando bater seu prÃ³prio record e desafiando seus amigos.

[i] Dica para os CaÃ§adores de Conquistas e Cartas. [/i] 
Segue um link com um guia para "facilitar" a aquisiÃ§Ã£o das Conquistas:
steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1735052829

[i] Roda em qual tipo de PC? [/i]
Tecnicamente falando, roda na maioria dos PCs. Mais a recomendaÃ§Ã£o seria com uma placa de video dedicada para evitar a queda de Frames.

[i] Ele Ã© difÃ­cil? [/i]
A mecÃ¢nica Ã© bastante simples, mas sua dificuldade e bastante elevada por causa do numero de inimigos. Estilo [b] Bullet Hell. [/b] Por causa deste fator poderÃ¡ afastar o pÃºblico. 

[i] Para melhor ExperiÃªncia do game. [/i]
O jogo Apresenta queda de Frames em Notebooks mais antigos. Recomenda-se em Notebook mais recentes ou PCs com placas de video [i] (minimo de 1GB) [/i]

[i] Vale a pena o investimento? [/i]
E um jogo e bastante barato, e apresenta varias promoÃ§Ãµes durante o ano barateando o jogo. Assim vale o investimento caso deseje o desafio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052707118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1553094994}
review:
Overhyped.

I grew up with these type of games since the 80s, so with this background I think I can judge saying that.

The music is not as good as the storepage would make you want to believe, neither are the graphics or the gameplay. It may be impressive if you never played something like it before though. But overall this is just a flash-game-like of wich the devs chose trying to milk the cow dry way too much seeing all the iterations keeping to show up constantly.

Play Neon Chrome instead if you want a full featured game in this vein that is actually good and has a decent amount of production value to it.

review: What an incredible game! Best class is gunner, if you want to have some fun and get the maximum score. The concept is simple, you get a gun or a blade, depending on the class you chose, and your objective is to kill as many mobs as you can in 90 seconds. Worth the money 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198122258825', 'num_games_owned': 3711, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1568767072}
review:
[list][*][b][h1]Morlan's shorts:[/h1][/b][/list]
I recently left a (negative) review for the "Wraith" instalment of this series and I just played this (and "Black") to try and see what differences these games have to warrant a whole series..
Frantic arcade action (fairly fresh at the time although a tad unfair and becomes overwhelming soon), good pump-up-the-volume soundtrack, inviting start up presentation/screen..
[b]If you never played any of these, try this one to see where it all started or wait until no.7 is finished[/b] and maybe that'll be more "complete" as an experience, but I still insist on my main points about the series: The basic graphics are very crude and the sprites aren't pleasant to the eye. The bullet-cutting mechanism is fun for a start but lasts only a little so after a while you're frustrated at the swarm of enemies that you cannot shoot/cut fast enough (the shoot/cut rate is kinda slow for the action). And in the three games I tried, the gameplay is pretty much the same: shoot/cut enemies/bullets, avoid getting hit and run constantly. Apart for very limited changes (like the "mana flash"), the graphics/sprites/music are essentially the same. Feels like experiencing the developer slowly completing ONE game rather than playing many different games. 

[b]For its price and coming out first I'll let this one slide because I can see some audience wanting this style of low-quality graphics, intense music and hectic (still ufair-ish) action[/b]. But only come in knowing that it's a hard game, it lasts 90'' and you need some masochism in your blood to want to be punished.. There you have it!

[b]Don't waste more time reading lengthy reviews.. time is of the essence![/b]

review:
Embora nÃ£o seja o meu gÃªnero de jogo favorito, achei UBERMOSH divertido pra passar um tempo e embora seja um jogo simples, ele vale o preÃ§o se vocÃª curtir o estilo de jogo, Ã© bem desafiador pra quem nÃ£o Ã© acostumado (como eu). A historia Ã© contada em uma frase no comeÃ§o do jogo e os grÃ¡ficos combinam muito com o estilo do jogo. NÃ£o encontrei bugs.
---------------------
Although it is not my favorite genre, I found UBERMOSH fun to spend time with and although it is a simple game, it is worth the price if you like the style of the game, it is very challenging for those who are not used to it (like me). The storyline is told in a sentence at the beginning of the game and the graphics closely match the style of the game. I did not find any bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052636113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1550796319}
review:
It is a top view deatmatch arena against dozens of AIs. The aesthetics are very good and makes the product unique. I like the neon cyberpunk touch. Apart of that, the game is very simple. The camera is too close to the player on purpose to add difficulty. Enemies won't shoot until they are relatively close so no surprises. You can return back the bullets with a sword, and because the bullets (plasma balls as a matter of fact) will break and scatter is actually worth, but cannot be used along with your own gun so requires some practice.

Campy casual fun in a short game. Nothing exuberant or special, but fun to mess with for a couple of hours. Enough to get the badges.

6.5 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198109348417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1548126397}
review:
Fun but flawed.
This game is exactly what it shows with very little added on to it, the challenges don't take long to complete and the FOV is very small meaning you can frustratingly run into enemies without even seeing them and you have little time to react to some scenarios. Overall it just feels kind of clunky and after playing Ubermosh Santicide it feels totally outdated. If you want a good fun game with more content and variables to experiment with get Ubermosh Santicide not this edition. I have beaten all challenges but one in my hour and fifteen minutes of play. If you want a game like this I'd recommend jumping in with santicide.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009839369', 'num_games_owned': 945, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1548664631}
review:
Ubermosh is a pain in the ass. Let me explain. 

It's a 2D bullet-hell game with a graphical style that melds Hotline: Miami and Far Cry: Blood Dragon. Your character has two weapons: a sword and a gun. The sword can, in addition to killing enemies, split and deflect their bullets which then kill whatever enemies that they hit. The basic gun fires two projectiles with each click of the mouse, and killing enemies will cause them to drop their own guns which you can then pick up and use. There appear to be four types of guns in the game: the basic gun, a gun which fires one large projectile that penetrates through enemies, a gun that fires three small projectiles, and gun that fires a bunch of really large projectiles. The last gun is by far the best, and is only carried by a single relatively uncommon enemy type. There appear to be several different enemy designs, but functionally the only way they differ is by which gun they carry and thus which gun they drop when you kill them. Getting shot by an enemy reduces your health by 1 no matter what gun they used. Getting hit by multiple projectiles at once from the same gun still only reduces your hp by 1. 

There are four classes in the game. No Class: has no gun but can pick them up, has a sword and 4 hp. Kensei: has no gun, cannot pick up guns, and has 6 hp. Warlock: starts with the best gun, has a sword, and 2 hp. Gunslinger: guns are full auto, has a starter gun and 3 hp. Gunslinger is the best of the four as far as high scores are concerned. 

My main problem with the game is that it's randomized. The levels are all a flat plane as one would expect from a bullet hell game. There are randomly generated pieces of cover strewn about the map, but they're all the same blocky rock-like structures. Enemies spawn in random orders and numbers. AI seems to fire at random with with no telegraphing, so there's no way to anticipate their attacks. This is really frustrating when trying to get the achievements, as there is a significant element of luck to the process. For example, if you're playing a gunslinger, the enemy that drops the best gun might be the 5th enemy you see or the 50th. If you're playing the Kensai, you might kite enemies halfway around the map without getting a chance to deflect a single bullet, or you might run into three enemies that all fire their weapons at you at once from different directions, making it impossible to avoid being shot. You might find a cover layout that funnels the enemies towards you while giving you ample room to avoid their attacks, or you might be cornered and obliterated. Enemies might spawn one at a time or by the dozens. This ends up with you having to play  round after round and die over and over, just hoping to get a run that presents you with the necessary circumstances for success. 

That said, this isn't a bad game. Considering that it appears to be made by one guy, there's a lot of polish here and I don't fault him for using the random encounter thing. I personally found it really frustrating, but I recognize that some people will enjoy this. Now that I've gotten all the achievements for the game I intend to uninstall it and I probably won't play it again. Still, I would give the game a 3/5 rating.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993531522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 347, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1459863758}
review:
A throwaway title that'll probably stay on your hard drive for no more than an hour or two. It's the type of game that you might play for about 10 minutes per session before getting jaded by its intensity and moving on. There are loads more absorbing and satisfying top down shooters out there.

For a full list of my favourite top down shooters, plus hundreds of reviews of indie titles, please follow or check out my website through my curator page at:

author: {'steamid': '76561197966468894', 'num_games_owned': 819, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1547952637}
review:
First of all, I dig the music. It pairs quite well w/ the gameplay. GJ!

If u watched the trailer, the gameplay is WYSIWYG. (U knew this.)

The sword is of course the elite weapon which u must practice to master but will be well-rewarded if u do. The gun is the wep to keep u interested/alive in the meanwhile.

BTW moved my save between PCs and noticed the in-game achievement progress did not carry over so beware of that. Complete it on one PC imo. But nbd.

All in all it's a nice package. A simple, skill-based game w/ enough thematic vibe and creative variation available in the gameplay to not have it be a throwaway.

Bought in bundle so I'm looking forward to seeing how the other games in the series develop it, or even [i]if[/i] they do ... the principle of "why mess w/ a good formula?" applies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004120455', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1537816642}
review:
UBERMOSH is a simple and very difficult arcade game similar to Robotron: 2084. As a smooth twin-skick shooter, it plays equally well with a mouse and keyboard or gamepad. (I usually find a mouse better for precision aiming and the gamepad for twitchy movement. I think the gamepad is slightly better for this game.) Enemies (technically competitors) stream in from the edges of the playfield attempting to kill you. Fortunately, you are armed with a gun and a sword. The sword is particularly useful as it serves both close combat and deflecting bullets. The game offers several player classes, including an arguably overpowered sword-only Kensai which can use no guns, but gets 6 lives. Mastering the sword is the key to the game, so it's a good class to start with.

You will dieâ€”constantly. Winning isn't possible, but there are steam achievements and high scores. (I gather a round ends after 90 seconds, which could be considered a win state if you make it.) It's really a classic arcade style designed to eat quarters. Fortunately, restarting is free (and quick). The idea is to keep learning from mistakes and improving your skill. It can feel a little bit unfair since the viewport is small compared to field of play. Enemies and projectiles come from all directions, but it would be nice to see more so that you can plan your moves. Still, most hits can be avoided with skill. 

Also, quite listenable music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198395376527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1545618012}
review:
Wow, estoy sorprendido con lo que se puede hacer con paciencia, pocos recursos (o tal vez no) y una mente muy, MUY creativa.
Ubermosh me ha dejado fascinado con su simplicidad pero con su alta calidad.
 Ubermosh nos pone al mando de un personaje femenino cuyo objetivo es sobrevivir 90 segundos (1 minuto y medio) en un area, todo va bien hasta que comienzan las oleadas de alienigenas que sin piedad nos dispararan una enorme cantidad de balas, para hacerle frente a esos enemigos tendremos nuestra fiel espada, capaz de cortar enemigos y de reflectar proyectiles. Luego de matar al primer enemigo (sea cual sea) podremos controlar su arma y podremos robarle el arma a cualquier enemigo, dando asi un estilo de juego "diferente" para cada jugador (lo pongo entre comillas porque basicamente vas a pasar todo el rato corriendo y disparando, pero meh). Un punto que influye mucho en la experiencia es... La musica, joder si es hermosa. Me ha gustado muchisimo como se logra poner en tension al jugador con esa musica entre Punk, electronica y rock.
 El juego con consta solo de un modo de juego sino que aparte tiene otros 3 modos de juegos y uno extra que le agrega aun mas dificultad al juego (para los buenos masoquistas 7u7).
 En conclusion, si ahora me preguntan si recomendaria el juego les diria absolutamente que si, tal vez no sea un juego que estes constantemente jugando, pero puedo prometer que te va a entretener muchisimo.
 Un punto importante que olvide mencionar es que el juego esta hecho por UNA SOLA PERSONA. Todo el trabajo de modelar los enemigos, mapas, de componer la musica y programar el juego esta hecho por una sola persona, mis respetos Walter Machado.
 Ahora, Â¿Deberias probar Ubermosh? Seeeeh

author: {'steamid': '76561198054437677', 'num_games_owned': 1070, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1543545094}
review: I want to recommend this game but the field of view just kills this game dead. I adore twin stick arcade shooters. Growing up with robotron 2084 is proof of that. There is even a game on steam called "circuit breakers" that does this set up right. as you can tell ubermosh is a twin stick shooter with great music and awesome pixel graphics. it wouldn't be bad if the view wasn't so zoomed in! it makes it literally impossible to make your next move without having at least one respawn go away or just a horde of enemies appear out of no where and obliterate you without dely. I love a challenge but this is flat out cheap with NO way of seeing incoming enemies before it's too late. This is the very reason I wish I knew how to mod. zoom out the view and this game would be worth playing over and over like I do with Robotron. Sad,really. Don't by unless it's .50,get circuit breakers instead.

Ideal game to play in between games. ABSOLUTELY RECOMMENDED.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057305726', 'num_games_owned': 2574, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1541475955}
review:
UBERMOSH is a reasonably fun arcade game, let down by a poor user interface, obstructing camera, and worst of all, frequent game crashes. Whenever my score reaches over 100 on any of the rounds, at some point, the client will freeze, forcing me to close the program or leave the round. Reinstalling the program did nothing, and since there in no settings menu in the game, I have no easy way to troubleshoot. Maybe this wouldn't be an issue in later instalments of the series, but I've lost intrest at this point as I have no way to play for 100% achivements.

Most users don't seem to be experiencing crashes, in which case, I'd give a casual recommendation, considering the low price. In it's current state for me, there's no point to continue playing.

review: æŒºçˆ½å¿«çš„è¡—æœºé£å°æ¸¸æˆï¼Œæƒ³å…¨æˆå°±è¿˜æ˜¯æœ‰äº›éš¾åº¦çš„ï¼Œä½†æ¸¸æˆä¸­ä¸€æ—¦æ•Œäººå°¸ä½“å¤ªå¤šå°±ä¼šå·¨å¡æ— æ¯”ï¼Œè€Œæ°å·§æˆ‘å°±å–œæ¬¢æ‹¿æœ€å¼ºæ­¦å™¨ç«™åœ¨åŒä¸€ä¸ªåœ°æ–¹ç‹‚å°„ï¼Œæ‰“ä¸ä¸€ä¼šå°±éå¸¸å¡ï¼Œè€Œä¸”æˆ‘æ¢åœ°æ–¹è¿˜éå¸¸å®¹æ˜“å› ä¸ºå¡è€Œå—ä¼¤ï¼Œæä¸ªå»ºè®®å°±æ˜¯ä¸è¦æ¯ä¸ªæ€ªç‰©éƒ½èƒ½æ‰æªï¼Œè¿™æ ·å°±ä¸ä¼šé€ æˆè¿™ç§æƒ…å†µäº†

author: {'steamid': '76561198128461059', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1560689688}
review:
UBERMOSH is a colourful, fast-paced, ruthless shooter. It's a lightning fast twitch-reaction arcade shoot 'em up that makes you feel like you've played it for far longer than you really have. 90 second rounds (if you make it to the end) last a lifetime as you move around kiting and murdering your way through masses of enemies in a fully badass manner.

The game has tight controls with the interesting "deflect bullets with sword" mechanic to set it apart from the crowd.
DOOM meets Super Hexagon; a steal at 39p with the OST on sale. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198135415645', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1543079325}
review:
Quite fun actually.

You have to kill enemies with guns or your sword and you have to survive untill you get extracted. the music is quite catchy, the graphics are ok, gameplay is simple and achievements are somewhat challenging. 

Great game, I bought it on sale and had quite some fun hunting its achievements, recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965984178', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1538678189}
review:
(â—•â€¿â—•âœ¿)
[h1]Wanna get gangbanged by guns? Here you go! the game[/h1]
But do you also wanna gangbang your enemies? Well here is your chance :P
Though it will not be that easy (not if you are a completionist XD) Gonna catch them all :P
Ãœbermosh is a top down bullet hell with a high demand of good reflexes
So probably not really recommended for the average casual players even though it might be good training.

I CANNOT SAY WETHER CONTROLLER OR MOUSE/KEYBOARD IS WORSE OR BETTER FOR THIS GAME.
but mouse and keyboard worked fine for me :) but some says it works better and is easier with controller

[h1]MoseÂ´s divided waters[/h1]
These listed things can be both good or bad depending on your gaming personality
- This game does not spoon-feed you: Right on, hard on!
- No story what so ever: Meaning no wasting time on foreplay, right to the action ;)
- Simple pixelated graphics: Purely naked, nothing shiny to attract your attention from the flaws!
- High heart pumping music: Rythm is always good! (or you can always mute it!)
- Simple gameplay: No need to get all highly advanged when the good old techniques works ;)
- Somewhat hard archievements: WORK FOR IT BABY!

[h1]Turnon: Why this game might work?[/h1]
Yes Ãœbermosh is nothing new, it is really does not bring any new interventions, it is what it is. 
But hey! sometimes we need that simple gameplay, just like if one likes to see sit-coms here and there, just to shut the brains off. And overall the game works pretty good with makes this game great for that little action packed 2 (or maybe more) minutes break because this game needs ALL of your attention!
If you are one who likes selfchallenges then beating your own highscore might be one hard to do!!! Adopt, improve and improvise! 

[H1]Turnoff: Why this games might fail[/h1]
Too hard is probably the most obvious reason, therefore I highly recommend non casual players! it has no mercy what so ever and the learning curve is somewhat quite high especially if you are not that skilled with your reflects and coordination!
No real variation what so ever? yes you have your 4 enemies types with their weapons and a tiny map that seems to maybe change a bit, but there is no more into it. If you have tried all classes then you have tried the game to the fullest.
I myself will probably not return to this game ever again, but I had fun doing it :) (though it has the potential always being returned to whenever you always can try to beat your highscore but it has it upperlimit)

So yeah, go hard on! or pass on, your choice :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197991367059', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1538356905}
review: Simple and fun game! it's very intense, I feel that at any moment something will hit me. The music fits very nicely on the theme, I felt hyped even if I've failed at an attempt. The last achievement, about only using the Sword was VERY difficult, but rewarding when I finally got it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136071037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1536930525}
review:
1 hitboxes on the character and/or the bullets are a bit too large 
2 minimal feedback + no i frames =  sudden death with slow learning 
3 enemies prefering to fire at close range where the large hitboxes and fast speed i am pretty sure outpace the lag from my mouse to pc.
4 all guns except for warlock are nearly useless as they slow down sword.

i feel like i hit my skill ceiling almost immediatly and breakawy successes are more due to lucky spawn and shot patterns
great game

author: {'steamid': '76561198009474997', 'num_games_owned': 2217, 'num_reviews': 1072, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1536100242}
review:
Another decent add on to your +1 collection for a great price.

The game's gameplay is amazing with only one flaw, the camera , it makes it hard to focus, and enjoy the game, keeping track of the screen's contents is really difficult, this is the only flaw in this game at this stage.

As for the rest of the game it really is amazing from the game itself with the amazing mechanics and the cyberpunk theme to top it all off, and to add a cherry on top,  pretty decent soundtrack adding to the overall amazing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047290897', 'num_games_owned': 1042, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1547603241}
review:
You play as a Sister of Battle from Warhammer40k fighting off hoards of mutants and aliens in a mosh pit.
Not really, but that is kind of what it feels like.


Edit: Having played and read more about the series, you are playing as "the Blade Saint" who shows up every few hundred years to fight off alien invasions or something like that.

Good for ~5 minute bursts of play or shorter, but easy to come back to.
Only downside is that the music and quick gameplay can aggravate ADD or ADHD issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162450124', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1633551972}
review:
This game is something else.
It has Electro Rock and Roll, weighty combat sounds, completely unbalanced weapons from the player and enemies, a narrator that sounds like Morgan Freeman, you can deflect bullets with a sword, and the game just makes you feel great in certain external organs.
The rest of the games are relatively the same, but each one makes you a little more overpowered. So, if you play one, play them all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077242222', 'num_games_owned': 2468, 'num_reviews': 444, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1534002194}
review:
Playing the game with this camera is like playing a FPS game with 10 fov. It's literally in your face and it's close to impossible to keep track of everything and avoid the increasing number of enemies and projectiles when you have no idea where you are going. The camera has to be zoomed out more for people to enjoy the game. In this state there is 0 enjoyment from gameplay that lasts less than a minute and dying the whole time. Your best bet is getting a gun with tons of spread and be good at guessing where the enemies are off-screen and shoot there.

Everything else in the game is great, the camera ruins it. And this is coming from a veteran gamer who loves playing bullet hell and all kinds of old-school shmup games. You don't want the camera to be too close(like here) or too far. There is always that sweet spot which many old shmup games have found. I'm getting tired of seeing games with "retro" style made by people who have never played retro games. On top of that there is no permanent auto-shoot for every class??? I'm not breaking my mouse over this 1 hour long shit. Thankfully my mouse has 2 left-click buttons so I don't have to use the main one.

review:
UBERMOSH avrebbe spaccato tantissimo nelle sale giochi di tanti anni fa.
E' un gioco arcade molto particolare, una partita dura 90 secondi... se riuscite a sopravvivere all' ingente numero di nemici e proiettili che vi piomberanno addosso. Ci sono diverse classi, ognuna con le sue caratteristiche e spetta a voi trovare quella che si addice di piÃ¹ al vostro stile per raggiungere lo scadere del tempo. Se siete giocatori in cerca di una sfida seriamente tosta ve lo consiglio ma a lungo andare puÃ² risultare monotono e frustrante, per questo consiglio giusto partite di 15-20 alla volta

review:
This game was worth more than the $0.50 paid. Very good for passing some time between classes or just testing your arcade gaming abilities. Would love to see more content in this artstyle, maybe a hack-n-slash RPG (personal bias)?

Either way, great game, probably has a good 20 hours of gameplay before it gets repetitive/ you complete all challenges.

Cheers,
Micah

author: {'steamid': '76561198197054298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1586890192}
review:
Oh my fucking god, really, this thing is INSANE(LY GOOD)!!!
I bought Ubermosh and Ubermosh vol 5 for a total of 25 cents, it had a great sale and i also got -33% from everything because my country sucks.
I didn't think a game at this price would be that good, i don't know when i jumped while playing a game and turned the metal volume to max.
This thing is very good! buy it! It's worth even the full price.

review:
Incredible game, good if you want to kill 5 minutes, or if you are ready to put in hours, the whole series is very similar, for 60 AAA games that would be a big problem, but due to the incredibly low prices it's fine. 
Fun, attractive gameplay,
Good soundtrack,
different options for defense vs offense
It's a great fucking game.
and its like, a buck

author: {'steamid': '76561198104194390', 'num_games_owned': 785, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1530224156}
review:
[h1]Soy mentor en Steam!![/h1]
[url]http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31570421/[/url]

Ubermosh es ese juego donde nada mÃ¡s clickar en su ejecutable ya estÃ¡s pegando tiros sin parar gracias a tu municiÃ³n infinita y a las oleadas de enemigos que se te echan encima. Un juego donde morir supone hacer un nuevo click para empezar una nueva matanza. Una experiencia hardcore por definiciÃ³n que desde luego no sirve para todo el mundo.

Es fÃ¡cil definir los problemas de Ubermosh. Con cada partida el juego se va empaÃ±ando. Incluso si llegas al final de la cuenta atrÃ¡s -unos 90 segundos- no hay nada mÃ¡s en Ubermosh, tan sÃ³lo ir superando tu record. SÃ­, el juego cuenta con distintas clases para potenciar algunos modos de juego, pero acaba siendo lo mismo. Partidas en sucesiÃ³n que duran en su mayorÃ­a menos de un minuto y con un feedback inexistente puedes creer que vas bien pero cuando miras estÃ¡s a punto de morir porque directamente no te enteras de cuÃ¡ndo te dan. En definitiva, Ubermosh se acerca mÃ¡s a un rage quit que a otra cosa.

Â¿Divertido? SÃ­, incluso con sus problemas Ubermosh es muy divertido. Una diversiÃ³n muy puntual, pero que debes abandonar a los pocos minutos a menos que quieras que la diversiÃ³n se torne en frustraciÃ³n. Ubermosh es el juego mÃ¡s casual hardcore del mundo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281612923', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1676471533}
review: Game made by one man who also recorded it's great soundtrack and it's fun ass hell. It's a simple arcade slash/shoot 'em up with retro graphics. It doesn't try to be something more, but is well made and replayable even being really hard. The controls are clever. Left stick - move, right stick - aim, left trigger/shoulder - slash, right trigger/shoulder - shoot, action buttons are for the menu. Keyboard uses the WASD - 2 button mouse scheme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078224950', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1524538681}
review:
This game would be a classic cult if it had the following two things:

1. More zoomed out camera so you don't  literally run into enemies and you can actually focus on shooting enemies instead of pre-firing.
2. If there was an option to lock your weapon so you don't pick up new ones by accident
3. There is a weird mouse delay which seems to be coming from forced vsync, this probably the only part I would call totally ridiculous.

TL;DR: Small but enjoyable game, that seems to suffer from a bit of bandaid design to make it artificially more difficult.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985596506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1521779435}
review:
I was expecting a twin-sticks bullet hell with a creepy-looking lady. This is what I got and so much more. The game is so fun and brilliant in its simplicity. The music is pumping, without being overbearing or repretitive. The environment is bare-bones, but that makes everything far easier to see when things get hectic. The enemies are very easy to recognize, as are their guns. You also get this cool katana that cuts bullets and enemies so you can swat projectiles back away from you in an arc. 

Overall, this game has better design than a lot of million-dollar titles out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018514111', 'num_games_owned': 3257, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1519489506}
review:
This is the first game to really make me fear widescreen.

It's a top-down skill/twitch/arena shooter where horizontal space is aplenty but scant vertical space just invites a hail of surprise lasers that'll be the death of you. So don't walk up or down if you don't have to. Moving feels kind of loose and basically encourages staying in one spot.

The bullet slicing concept is marvellous (basically countering attacks without it turning into a QTE) and should be evolved outside arena shooters. I'd love to see a game where it's the main thing and not just the defense using your startling reaction.

The aesthetic is flawless, and this game isn't nearly as difficult as you have reviewers proclaim. I guess it's been tweaked around, and the designer made like five of these games, each ostensibly just a retune, so I guess it's a really popular game. Anyway, it's fun for a bit but you'll outgrow the original's limitations and easy ways of getting a high score fairly fast, so I guess that's why all the sequels. Five games in all! Wow.

Oh yeah, looks like Steam underestimates the hours clocked again. Typical.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101220317', 'num_games_owned': 1594, 'num_reviews': 740, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1520646522}
review:
Bom jogo.

O jogo consiste em sobreviver.
Com um nivel de dificuldade extremo e uma jogabilidade bem simples o jogo tem um desafio interessante.
Escolha sua arma. Seja atirando nos inimigos ou usando a espada rebatendo o fogo dos adversarios.
Arma 1 - Espada (rebate fogo inimigo)
Arma 2 - Bazuka 1 tiro
Arma 3 - Laser 2 tiros
Arma 4 - Laser 3 tiros
Arma 5 - Laser 4 tiros

Existe uma possibilidade de nascer com 2, 3, 4 ou 6 vidas.. 
Claro que a arma que ira pegar sera proporcional ao numero de vidas escolhido. Exemplo se escolher 6 vidas ira comecar somente com uma espada.

PÃ³s
- Jogabilidade.
- Armas legais.
- Trilha Sonora adequada.

Contras
- Nao existe parede nas laterais tornando impossivel encostar nos cantos ou fugir de inimigos de fora do ''ring''.
- Dificuldade muito alta.
- Campo de visao muito limitado tornando impossivel ver os tiros adversarios chegando de alguns pontos.
- Espada muito lenta.

O jogo e bem interessante porem um nome adequado para o game? Impossivel fugir!
Nao tem para onde correr.. Nao existe bug que voce possa fazer para tentar ganhar algum tipo de vantagem ou proteÃ§ao. Tem que ganhar na raÃ§a.. Um desafio legal porem bem limitado. A versao 1 e 2 do jogo sao praticamente identicas e por esse motivo usarei a mesma analisa para ambos. Nao achei nada de diferente alem do MENU principal. As opÃ§oes do game sao iguais. Caso alguem jogue porfavor me corrija caso esteja errado.

Recomendo somente em promoÃ§ao. Jogo e bom porem muito limitado e praticamente impossivel ganhar sem tentar 8948990345x...

Duvidas ou sugestoes? Postem aqui. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198285655730', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1598719007}
review:
So, I decided to give this game another try, since I was looking for something to do with my extremely functional days, and I can say: I got pretty mad at times.

Game has plenty of challenge, since being slow is not an option in UBERMOSH, meaning you constantly have to be aware of what the A.I. is going to do and when, even more so when the mode is changed to hardboiled, given the amount of enemies coming at you becomes way bigger.

Cheese factor is also present in this game, especially for the 150 kills/survive 7 times achievements, if you decide to get them in normal mode that is.

Hardboiled would be my go-to mode if I'm feeling like a challenge, gunner mode more so because cheese factor is just incredible: take the four shot weapon and just spray around like a crazy man who just left the asylum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053510098', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1516673556}
review:
+It's a dollar.
+Fast.
+Challenging.
+Weapons feel great.
+Music.

-Gun/sword switch cooldown is frustrating.
-Gun cooldown seems to have some rng.
-Cover is random and it largely determines your survival.
-The narrow view is artificial difficulty, mitigated by cover, which is random.

If you like twitch twin stick shooters it's a decent diversion, otherwise, the frustrating elements make this not fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071165689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1516838186}
review:
After a long time of looking at this game in my library, I decided to give it a try, and golly, this game is way worse than I thought it would be.

   So, you choose your class-mod in the upper left of the title screen, since the UI is terrible and you probably didn't know that was a feature until you looked at the achievements, and then you hit play.

   You load in, and the first 10 seconds of the 90 the "event" lasts is waiting for enemies to appear. Once they do, you have to either shoot them if you chose a class mod, or deflect their bullets with your sword to kill them and grab theirs. It sounds like a great idea, except the amount you can see is the equivalent of trying to dodge a pole looking at your own feet.

   The left and right sides are good; you get enough warning from there. However, an enemy above or below your screen can take one step and fire, making you tank the damage unless you have a -4 second reaction time. My -3 second didn't cut it.

   The events then ramp up in difficulty by having 50 Quinquagintillion enemies swarming you, with no invulnerability time between hits, so you can have 4 seconds left on the event, then eat 4 bullets at once and lose.

   This game is cheap, because the gameplay is. I will continue to play it to get the achievements, then the last button I get to press is the uninstall one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058584412', 'num_games_owned': 9611, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1514753684}
review: Despite this not being a game for me, and me not really being very good at it, I can see why people like it.  It seemed to control well and even though I wasn't good at the game, I still played more than my fair share of rounds, just hoping it would click and I would have a great round.  And really, the game being fun enough to do that is something more games should really strive for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 654, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1704418344}
review:
This game is so good. It is ridiculously short (each game is measured in seconds), but the game play is so good. It is just so exciting to play, with the excellent music and controls. I have been coming back to it over and over, and I only just recently been getting the hang of it. UBERMOSH is a game that you can pickup, play over a few minutes, and put it down feeling like you had a really good time.

Update: I recently got an achievement in ubermosh. This is the first one in all the many, many times that I have played it. Ubermosh makes you earn the title of hardboiled. This is not the type of game that gives you a prize for making it through the tutorial.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080319088', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1515857163}
review:
Welcome to UBERMOSH!

What you see in the trailer and the screenshots is what you get.
Not more.
Not less.

Twinstick Shooter. 
Very challenging and fun for 1-2 hours.
Bought it during a sale for 9 cents.
Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184080210', 'num_games_owned': 1562, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1515273965}
review:
Â¿Te gusta Nuclear Throne? Entonces tenÃ©s que jugar a su antecesor: U B E R M O S H.

Ubermosh es un juego divertido, MUY DIFÃCIL, pero divertido. Tiene pocos logros, pero 3 de los 7 logros, para mÃ­, son muy difÃ­ciles. Eso depende del criterio de cada uno. Cada partida dura 80 segundos, pensarÃ¡s que es poco, pero al jugar parece como si pasaran 30 minutos. Es un juego muy frenÃ©tico (y su OST lo hace mucho mÃ¡s frenÃ©tico de lo que es), quizÃ¡s le falta variedad (Y UN MAPAAAA), pero al spawnear tantos bichos a la vez, no se nota la poca variedad. 
El balance de las armas no estÃ¡ bien, o sea, hay 4 armas:
1. Una sola bala pero mÃ¡s grande y gorda
2. 2 balas largas
3. 3 balas redondas
4. 6 balas largas
Sugongo que se dan cuenta de la diferencia, Â¿No?
Pero, es un buen juego, y no requiere una buena PC, 100% recomendado.

8/10 - Vred

review: UBERMOSH is a very fun arcade like game where you're in this arena and you have to fight enemy after enemy after enemy. I don't think i really have to go in detail about the gamplay other than it's very fast paced and makes you feel like a badass. This game was also made by the people who made SWARMRIDERS so you know that ya boy is being hit up with those those good soundtracks (music is good). It also has a very cool 80's vibe/ aesthetic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060718434', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1513237047}
review:
I do not recommend the game, though the music is good. Still needs work to be a proper bullet hell game. The hit box is way too big, you move too fast with absolutely zero control, moving too much is a death sentence, and the camera is trying to leave the game at every waking second.

The balde mechanic is cool though.

If you like it, good for you, but this game has many glaring issues that turn it sour for me.

5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132780522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1511630082}
review:
The colony provides us everything except for violence.

The gameâ€™s tagline is a fitting one, since this title provides nothing but violence in wholesome abundance. To put in summary, Ubermosh is a fast pace, bullet hell game, in which you must survive for as long as possible and compete for a high score.

A typical session of play would last between 10 to 90 seconds, though more likely than not, you will experience a short life of less than 30. This is by no means bad, since you are pump and psyched to abort, retry and fail; over and over again. The mechanics is simple, as a rookie gladiator you must utilise your sword to slice bullets that are fired your way, that or dodge to avoid your demise.

Any creatures you kill in the Mosh Pit will drop their gun, with which there are 4 variants to pick from. While they might function in similar ways, the firing rate and spread pattern are different, so you must learn and adapt according to different situations. Turtling can be a good tactic, but you also unwittingly minimised your encounters with foes, thus limiting your end score. Run and Gun might work better score wise, but you run the chance of dying early. The game rewards you well in weighting the risks and taking the gambit accordingly.

Music was another aspect of the game done well, sporting a soundtrack over 30 minutes long, it accentuates the chaotic action to a new height. You will be motivated to survive longer, for each subsequent round, just so you can hear the track go further beyond. While I donâ€™t normally buy game soundtracks on Steam, this is one of the rare occasions which I did, with no regrets.

The weakest department of this title, arguably, would be the story. Letâ€™s be honest, the lore is practically nonexistent here, though for an arcade game, it didnâ€™t need an extensive one. In another way, the lack thereof plays to the favour of this game by remaining vague. As each sequel in the series contain a tag line with which the plot advances slightly, while revealing little in the progress.

For conclusion, if you are new to the series and donâ€™t mind spending a few dollars, I would say get it all in chronological order (or in a bundle). Though if you are really strapped for cash, just get the latest release of the series instead, since you arenâ€™t missing much besides minor changes in mechanics and game modes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255296374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1703915712}
review:
UBERMOSH is a very fun arcade like game where you're in this arena and you have to fight enemy after enemy after enemy. I don't think i really have to go in detail about the gamplay other than it's very fast paced and makes you feel like a badass. This game was also made by the people who made SWARMRIDERS so you know that ya boy is being hit up with those those good soundtracks (music is good). It also has a very cool 80's vibe/ aesthetic.

While this game is VERY bare bones in gameplay and execution i'd have to say that i did enjoy this game more than SWARMRIDERS and I can see myself returning to this game in the near future 

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198031954285', 'num_games_owned': 814, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1509634049}
review:
Outstanding game!

Ubermosh is really simple to play (WASD + mouse buttons), very intense (map gets full of enemies quickly) and rewarding. The music is incredible, and each run gives this thrilling sensation

The game is pretty short, and depending on how fast you develop your skill, you can get all achievements in a few hours. It's always worth coming back for some more runs though

review:
Bare bones 'bullet hell / twin stick shooter' dipped in a cyberpunk aesthetic. 
Quick paced gameplay even running the timer out will only take 90 seconds.
Responsive controls. Superb soundtrack. Great price. Mouse/kb or pad. One man dev team.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 1576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1576, 'last_played': 1507891323}
review:
Tags: Topdown Shooter
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Good initial core concept execution which got iterated on in a lot of mini sequels. This suffers from small FOV. Play newer versions instead.

http://store.steampowered.com/app/640380/UBERMOSH_Vol5/

Community seems to be supportive and pricing is appropriate. I dislike library clutter so if I could please be excused to UbermoshV until the dev iterates and improves it again. Perhaps this should be F2P as a demo for the franchise. It got me to buy the latest one...

Camera too zoomed in and, partially due to my current display perhaps, felt very claustrophobic and unwieldy leading to very short abrupt sudden death sessions where I could not even map out what was happening.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007984256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1506305612}
review: UBERMOSH is an amazing game! It's arcade nature makes it a great pick up whenever the time feels right, it's challenging yet addictive. The Gameplay, Environment and Soundtrack are all very well done!! I just purchased more games from this dev and I can't wait to give them a try!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972661722', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1505590030}
review:
UBERMOSH is awesome! I wish there were more games like this, the kind that you can just pick up, start playing with no nonsense, and then put back down because you feel fulfilled (or decided on a better use of your time).

The soundtrack is awesome, the pixel art is very well done, the gore is comical, and the different class mods add some spice. There's no story here, just bullet hell and you trying to beat your previous score. Simple, fun, worth much more than what the developer is selling it for. My only disappointment is that I didn't find this series sooner!

author: {'steamid': '76561198130516505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 324, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1502480392}
review:
UBERMOSH is a hardcore cyberpunk bullet-hell game in which you can cut, shoot and deflect to try and survive for as long as possible.

Pros:
-Gameplay is fast and solid, which is greatly needed in a bullet-hell. Movement is responsive and fast.
-Visually stunning with it's pixel-cyberpunk feel to it, giving slight feelings of an 80's sci-fi to it
-Music and sound effects are amazing
-It has trading cards and Steam Achievements
-It is brutally unforgiving, as a bullet-hell should be
-Different classes, each which take a different playstyle to master

Cons:
-None

Overall, this is one of the, if not the best bullet-hell games I've played in a long time and at R12 (~$1) it's definitely worth a look.
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198397308153', 'num_games_owned': 930, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1538898720}
review:
This game is a blast. Challenging, chaotic, rage-inducing...  pure bullet hell fun. 

Very apt soundtrack as well which matches the pace and vibe of the game play.  If only I didn't die so quickly everytime my favorite track played...

After playing this for 30 minutes, I bought the other 4 games in this series. 

Sure, they could've been packaged all together in one game with multiple chapters, but that's a small gripe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142103361', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1531716852}
review:
A great arcade game with simple and fun mechanic. No loading screen, no death screen, no bullshit, You just go. Like other good arcade games, you improve everytime you play and keep beating your last high score. 

Too bad for me everytime i reach around 200 points the game starts to stutter for no reason. It's certainly unacceptable since by that point i'll be dead in no time. But no one else seems to be having this issue so i will still recommend it.

review:
Ã¨ un titolo che va affrontato con un approccio puramente arcade, qui bisogna sparare a tutto ciÃ² che si muove indistintamente e difendersi dai loro colpi con una sorta di spada laser la quale Ã¨ in grado utilizzandola di rispedire i proiettili diretti al loro mittente, il tutto situato all'interno di delle arene futuristiche dalle tonalitÃ  fantascientifiche, quasi sembra fare intendere ai giocatori che in realtÃ  questo gioco sia una sorta di sport
ottimi controlli e comandi, difficoltÃ  molto ben calibrata
tuttavia: l'interfaccia grafica Ã¨ troppo semplicistica arrivando ad un punto tale da essere essenziale, ben poche opzioni di gioco, ambienti da esplorare e storia totalmente assenti, una colonna sonora che tutto sommato non Ã¨ poi cosÃ¬ eccezionale; sono tutti elementi che disincentivano dall'utilizzare qusto prodotto
creato apposta per eseguire una partita divertente ogni tanto, ma il mio giudizio finale Ã¨: se evitate Ubermosh non vi perdete di certo un granchÃ¨

author: {'steamid': '76561197999311857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1500133616}
review:
Puah, would I recommend this game ? Probably, but in the end it was the missing finetuning that threw me off. Don't get me wrong the fast gameplay is fun, but if you want to feel like you failed because you weren't good and not because it was random, then this game can be quite frustrating at times.
I'm getting straight to the point, these are the problems I had while playing:


-Low Fov
  The camera is awfully close to your playermodel, it is
  so close that it is a risky move to go up and down the
  map because you might randomly run into an enemy
  that will immediately shoot you.

-Enemy Ai
  Enemies move pretty random over the map, so far so
  good, but they shoot you at an almost fixed distance
  and that distance is so close to you that deflecting
  bullets is more guessing than reacting, wouldn't be 
  too big of a problem if most classes didn't start 
  without a gun, and one class that entirely focuses on
  the blade.

-Hitbox
  I have honestly no idea how big the hitbox of the 
  playermodel is but I'm pretty sure it's too big, some 
  bullets hit where there should be atleast 1 or 2 pixels
  (ingame pixel not screen pixel) space left.

-Invisible bullets
  Bullets are sometimes pretty big, they spawn a 
  small distance in front of the enemy and they 
  disappear when they hit you, if you are close enough
  to an enemy and there isn't enough space they don't
  spawn at all, or better you just can't see them so you
  get killed by literally nothing.

-Movement not precise
  keyboard or controller, the minimum-distance you 
  move is about 2 playermodel-sizes which lacks, in my
  opinion precision.

-No options menu
  There is just none, if i wouldn't be able to adjust the 
  dpi of my mouse this game would have been 
  unplayable.

All these points combined gave me lots of "What killed me?", 
"... Wat?" and "I was shot with nothing... yay" -moments.
Which aren't really good moments for a videogame , but if you still want to play this or atleast try it out, wait for a sale 50 cent is okay I guess.

Edit:
Seriously... just skip straight to Ubermosh Vol. 5
-Black adds a 360 attack after a specific amount of kills.
-Vol. 3 adds wider Fov(which is nice), and takes away the rocks 
-Wraith adds a timed area attack.
-Vol. 5 has all of that.
...but still no options-menu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116315935', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1499355275}
review:
This game is at the staggeringly low price of $0.49 as of writing this review, and it's worth every penny.

I know that doesn't sound like a bold statement, because that's only 49 pennies, and it's weird because I was gifted this game, but hear me out.

This doesn't have much content, which is okay for it's current price, but it's still an awesome game. The controls and fluid and tight, the music is plain awesome, the visuals are simple and brilliant, the gameplay is satisfying, it's everything you would hope for for a game this cheap. Pick it up, you've definintely got the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040896113', 'num_games_owned': 729, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1519799182}
review:
Fast-paced gameplay, Fantastic soundtrack and nice pixelated graphics. UBERMOSH may be somehow short or straightforward for some, but it is doing its best to make some crazy joyful moments shooting and slashing enemies!

PS: Super Meat Boy, SUPERHOT and UBERMOSH (and others I don't remember) are making a good hype by saying their names in their special ways. This was one if the reasons I got the will to pay them, and I confess that this is a successful crazy manner!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044033757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1498078821}
review:
It is an ok time waster. 6/10
A bit of false difficulty. If you could zoom the camera back like 20% the game would be insanely easy so they zoom it in. This makes enemies just offscreen harder to react to, and their shots spawn just infront of them thus some hits will start to feel cheap. Like something else is wrong besides your reaction speed. 
Yet I recomend it for the price alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208262067', 'num_games_owned': 662, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1591581886}
review:
I got this game on sale for 49 cents.

It was money well spent.

UBERMOSH is a sci-fi hack n slash shooter thing drenched with blood, neon, and bullets. It has a soundtrack that that pairs nicely with its frantic bullet hell gameplay, so I'd recommend you buy the OST with it.

To put it bluntly, this game came here to kick ass and chew bubblegum.

And it's all out of bubblegum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096310474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1518896892}
review:
Un juego espectacular el cual casi siempre lo encontraras a un bajo precio, me compre la coleccion y todos me han gustado, ademas, he ido recibiendo los demas juegos que ha hecho este hombre de forma gratuita por unos  600 pesos chilenos (si no me falla la memoria).
Es frenetico, es entretenido, tiene una banda sonora expectacular, los controles responden al instante.
Vas morir tanto como lo que llegas a matar y aun asi no te aburres, tiene una difiicultad elevada (segun yo que no tengo manos) pero jamas injusta, si mueres sientes que es por tu culpa y no por que el juego asi lo quiso.
La pantalla normalmente se llena de enemigos y de balas pero esto no hace que te pierdas entre toda la balacera, lo cual creo que es por su fondo oscuro y todo lo que sea enemigos es con atractivos colores neones.
Tiene unas mecanicas bastante interesantes en especial cortar las balas y devolverlas, es un placer matar haciendo eso.
En otras palabras... Divertido, dificil, atractivo visualmente, cortas balas, cortas monstruos ( o lo que sean :3). Un juego maravilloso.

review: I really enjoy the 80s arcade-style action that permeates everything UBERMOSH.  This first release is a "Don't Miss" if you get nostalgic for this genre.  Take frequent breaks and maybe even buy a joystick with a turbo button - otherwise you may get blisters on your thumbs from this game.  I found this game for less than $2, but I would still say that's a good value for the entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009596311', 'num_games_owned': 5864, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1492061391}
review:
Overall Score: 4/10 For Achievement Hunters Only 
Reviewed April 12th 2017

Pro:

The music is great to listen to, but distracts the laser like focus one is required to harness if they wish to stand a chance accomplishing the goals set in the game.

Getting 100% achievement for the game takes around 2-3 hours pending how lucky you are and how quickly you understand how spawn placement works.

Cons:

The gameplay design decisions are ultimately the reason I'm downvoting the game. Enemy projectiles will randomly phase through walls while none of the guns you can pick up will phase through walls. Enemies will teleport onto the battlefield within a short distance outside of the screen, making location awareness and shooting off screen the measurement of life and death. The display is presented in widescreen and due to how fast the enemy is in the game, makes vertical assaults the only real threat. 

Finally, the most annoying aspects are having the guns swapped without your consent until the Ultra Shotgun is acquired and the screen shaking during every attack. This isn't a game where all 3 rotating guns are balanced. All enemies require one bullet, making area of effect the most important tool in your arsenal.

In Closing:
It's a very basic arena shooter/slasher I've seen many times for flash games. Pick up guns, fire them with one button and deflect bullets with the default melee weapon. The artificial difficulty makes the game too annoying for a legitmate, enjoyable game experience. I see people only playing it past the first two playthrough for Steam Achievements and nothing more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059126249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1514071805}
review:
This game has potential but has 2 major flaws.

Firstly, the gameplay lacks substance. 6 minutes in and I just achieved SSS rank. That doesn't seem right...

Secondly, the view is much too small. Your player is also closer to the bottom of the view due to the perspective you play from. That means when moving down there's not enough time to react.

I don't think it's worth getting. I paid 0.50 for it, and I still feel robbed. I'm not going to knock on Valve's door to refund it since it hardly costs anything, but I really hope the developer reads this and addresses these issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013858426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1491634667}
review:
Played for 12 minutes, left the game with nothing but respect and a need to write a review immediately.

This is exactly the sort of game people need to play to understand the era of gaming anyone 30 or above endured in their childhood: games that don't pretend to be anything but absolutely unforgiving and leave you wanting more.

10/10 a must have for anyone who wants to play a challenging game or to gift to someone who thinks they are just plain awesome at everything.

Oh and be a good cyberpunk - just dive straight into to purchasing the Desktop Distortions Bundle to get some guaranteed value on the cheap AND support an Indie developer who is worth their salt! Don't worry, the game is also good at producing plenty of salt too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041108401', 'num_games_owned': 1219, 'num_reviews': 496, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1627518519}
review:
[h1] Shoot the Off-screen Simulator [/h1]
First off: I 100%ed this game (did all challenges), so I'm not bad at this game.
You basically just spam bullets in all directions and hope for the best.
Since this game is so extremely zoomed in you can't see any enemies incoming. So most likely some enemy will appear behind you and hit you before you can react. Therefore the best strategy is to camp at a wall so noone can come from behind and spam bullets in all directions. If you do that right you don't see any enemies 90% of the time. That's why I call it "shoot the off-screen simulator".

Ok, I admit I had some fun doing all the challenges, but only because I like getting achievements and 100%ing games. Still the game design is bad and despite there are several classes the game is very repetitive and stale. The fact that this game is sold in [b]EIGHT[/b] independant versions which should have been patches is a fact of wrong of its own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089574752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1682486420}
review:
Fast paced and fun.
This game is an adrenaline joyride, you don't even have to be good to get engrossed in this game.
Bullet slicing, an innovative way of reflecting, has to be one of my favorite concepts to ever grace an arcade style game.
I love the aesthetic, the cyberpunk bullet hell that is ubermosh is quite the spectacle.
Even though the game is early access, it is overwhelmingly entertaining, and it's unbeatable for the price.

review: You get to cut bullets in half and run around feeling cooler than the Matrix. Kensai is A1 class; there is nothing quite like smoothly spin deflecting a storm of bullets from all around you and then dying two seconds later to one stray bullet when you think you have a moment to rest. And come on - the price is so good for this game. It's not hours of content, but it is a badass, fun little time waster.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995284838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1494378514}
review:
I think this game is great, but at the same time theres a pacing problem. The difficulty curve is breakneck and the gameplay is great in itself. The main problem is the disconnect when you die is pretty obnoxious. When you die, which will happen a lot, you have to wait around 1.5 seconds for it to say you're 'being extracted' and then you're at the start screen, then you can hit play again then you wait another 5 seconds for stuff to start showing up on screen. The problem is that 6.5 seconds is seriously jarring for me personally because it's like you're ready for the bullet hell and you died instantly but now you have to wait another 6.5 seconds for the game to wind up to a speed that feels instense and fun.

Hotline miami did it well at times. Here's it's sort of like that but a time survival thing. The big difference here is that hotline miami  never took away your control of the pacing. Which would often time leads to massive frustration that you died for the 20th time  on a level and you just throw yourself at it and do everything as fast as possible with the most and sometimes you could smash out a part on just sheer frustration because the second you died you were back in the fight again. That 6.5 seconds is seriously jarring here. One second im cutting waves of bullets and sending them back the sheering sound effect is really great, and then suddenly it says being extracted since i died to a massive light show that...snuck up on me. and im like FUCK and then in the next 6.5 seconds my adrenaline high is gone because it has to crawl up to speed again. It's a fun game and really if it's on sale it's completely worth it. Even might be if it's not on sale. But the fact that it takes so long to move from attempt to attempt really kills the adrenaline fast pacing that this type of game has going for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989991819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1523826001}
review:
Fast-paced, top-down, arena action with an interesting bullet-deflection mechanic.

Cyber-punk themed with a dash of anime aesthetic, UBERMOSH  is a brilliant way to spend 90 seconds of your day, and for 50 cents, the price is right.

  This won't keep you entertained for hours at a time, but it's simply not that kind of game.  Get in, have fun, get out, and come back for more later. It's even more impressive in that it appears to be a one-man project.

Give it a go if you have half a dollar in your wallet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097381432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1487438997}
review:
don't waste your money on this game.
It's a very basic and cheap top down shooter without any depth to it.
The goal of the game is to kill as many enemies as you can within a time limit.
You can shoot with one of four avaible weapons or use katana to either attact enemies or reflect their bullets.
The enemies are equipped with a random weapon which you can use if you kill them.
There is only one very small and uninteresting map in the game.
The camera is definately way too close to the character making it very difficult to see the incoming adversaires.
The screen shakes abnoxiously every time you shoot which only makes the gameplay worse.
There are no options allowing for changing anything.
It's a bad game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075996214', 'num_games_owned': 580, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1487080278}
review:
Es un juego simple, muy llano, pese a ello pide mucha intensidad y concentraciÃ³n. Es para aquellos que busquen un pequeÃ±o reto de dificultad. Â¡Es muy dependiente de los reflejos!

En sÃ­ no encontramos mucha variedad, los tipos de enemigos se cuentan con una mano, pero no te hace falta mÃ¡s. Tu objetivo es conseguir matar el mÃ¡ximo de ellos esquivando en un bullet hell cenital. Para ello dispondremos de una espada y un arma de fuego. Mientras que una nos protejera cortando y tambiÃ©n devolviendo proyectiles, el arma se encargarÃ¡ de limpiar el mapa de enemigos.

El juego carece de historia y demÃ¡s, es un solo mapa, el cual varÃ­a cada vez en muros a modo de arena y nos da 90 segundos para sobrevivir tratando de matar el mayor nÃºmero de enemigos.

Para hacer el juego entretenido y darle una meta, el propio creador nos ha dado una serie de logros los cuales serÃ­an el go-to de este shooter poniendo a prueba nuestra habilidad. No es para nada sencillo, y para el precio que tiene se compensa fÃ¡cilmente.

Recomendado para gente que busque un reto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018243990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1511384265}
review:
Okay, so, [i]UBERMOSH[/i]... I thought it was some random 8-bit crap that I probably won't like. But, I bought it anyway, since it sounded good. 

After installing it, I enter the main menu and feel weirded out by this weird-looking green-haired woman on the screen, but anyway, I go through the tutorial. And so far, it felt easy enough.

I start the game, and I play for like a few minutes. And then, I felt it was a nice buy, and then I quit the game and don't go back to it until I did recently.

20 minutes in, I realise how much this game can tick a person off. I had some negative thoughts about it. Like, why did I even buy an 8-bit crapola like this? Why does my respawn chance go down by one within less than 10 seconds? Why are the bullets firing toward me before I could even see it? Why is the area not big enough? What the fuck is so good about this fucking piece of shit game? 

5 more minutes in, I rage quit. 

Right after that, I calmed down. And then I realise that the game was meant to do just that. To test your skills. [b][u]Git gud or git rekt.[/u][/b] 

What I'm telling you is there's no graphical awesomeness with this game, there's no storyline, there's no concrete objective. You simply survive until your time runs out, which is 90 seconds. That sounds easy, right? Well, it's not. I rage quit, and thought about writing a negative review, just to spite it. And even after all that, this game is really entertaining. It's like one of those games with which you could develop a love-hate relationship. It's also a game which you either get addicted to for a long time, or you come back to occasionally.

The soundtrack is a huge plus. I love it, even though most of the tunes are very similar, so it [b]can[/b] be a bore for some, but that's only if you're the kind whose excitement for things dies off really fast. I, for one, think the soundtrack is what keeps my sanity in control as I slash through my pixelated enemies, because I die in like 30 seconds. Which is infuriating. 

Is it worth the buy? Definitely! Is it worth the buy in its full price? That's upto you, but I bought it during sale, and you ought to buy the full collection. Is it worth the buy during sale? Hell yeah, don't miss it out! And if not for the gameplay, atleast for the music (if you're a metal/rock fan, haters look elsewhere).

There's not much difference between this game and its follow-ups, except for maybe some changes or additions made to the soundtracks, and they're comparatively easier than this one, especially [i]UBERMOSH: BLACK[/i]. Other than that, it's pretty much the same. So, this review applies to all of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059971262', 'num_games_owned': 2465, 'num_reviews': 632, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1499803657}
review:
Okay. My first impression of this game was "That's it?" "Is it possible to last more than 30 seconds?" 

I spent like 5 minutes and didn't opened the game for several months. 


Now, after distancing myself a bit from the first time... This game isn't half bad! It's actually great! Sure, it's simple, hard, the content feels a bit minimal, but... It's really satisfying. Slashing, shooting hordes of enemies while avoiding bullets... It's a real blast. It's not the kind of game you'll play for a long session, but it's definitely the kind where you'll go back and see if you can survive and beat your best score.

It's hard as nail at first, but once you get the grip on how to play, it's actually quite easy.

It's the usual "arcade game" formula boosted to the max (and perfected) with a rad soundtrack.

 My PB right now is 311! Think you can beat me?

author: {'steamid': '76561198089234022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1665713759}
review:
This game is EXTREMELY simple; from the graphics to the controls. However, while simple, it is one of the best small games I've ever had the privilege of playing. The gameplay, being as simple as it is, is extremely easy to pick up and learn. Mastering this game is another story entirely, I got to blade saint after, say, thirty tries. And I just kept going back. The announcer, the oddly satisfying feel of deflecting bullets, the insane moments you can have, the little hint of a story behind the scenes. All in all this game has what it needs to be GOOD, it could be better of course, every game could be better. Also I find my self wanting a multiplayer, defecting one another's bullets sound stupid fun. I wholeheartedly recommend this to anyone with some time to kill or a competitive spirit.
G.G
Mr.E

author: {'steamid': '76561198079795608', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 24, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1712330350}
review:
Watch the trailer. What you see is what you get.

Fast-paced shooting action with a twist.
The twist being that plasma sword that can cut and reflect bullets.

Controls are tight, music is mindblowing, difficulty is harsh.
Last point could be because I'm a scrub.
But it is tons of fun though.

It is one of my favorite guilty pleasures.
Utopian Ultraviolence on Ultakaar.

Oh. Don't measure this game in time played. 
Measure it in heart-beats, never been so pumped up by a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078679059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1523767951}
review:
Now usually I'm a very opened minded sort of guy that doesn't shy away from most games. There are two kinds of games I like, ones with a meaningful narrative that also works into the game play, that's "Oneshot", and one with fast paced kick ass game play, that's "F.E.A.R". Now sometimes those can mix together and make a deformed hybrid of a child that has tourettes [spoiler](makes you swear randomly)[/spoiler] that's your postal 2, which I personally think is one of my favorite games. Too bad that the country I lived in completely forgot the time that they were trying to be important like America [spoiler](its banned if you haven't figured it out)[/spoiler]. 

Now "UBERMOSH" falls into the latter category and I'm happy to say that what it says in the trailer is what it is. It's a fast paced hack and shoot game that is based around your reflexes and judgment skills, and you have to survive waves upon waves of morons for a certain time. 

[u]Gameplay[/u] 
The gameplay is based around your usage of the sword and gun. your sword can cut enemies and deflect bullets back at them, and a gun does what you think it does. There is very little variety in what gun does what and fall into a line graph of the worst to the best. Now you only have 90 seconds to survive which may not sound much, but it does feel like an eternity. Enemies are relentless and will constantly make you twitch around the screen to check your every angle, making it pretty enjoyable for anyone who wants a challenge in less than 5 minutes. 
 
Then you got your classes, you got your classless that starts with a sword, and can grab a gun. Your Kensai that has more health but can't pick up guns. Your gunner that has automatic fire with guns but can't use the sword and has less health and your warlock that starts with the best gun but with the least amount of health. Now obvious problem start to rise like, why would you need a gunner when she fires as fast as when you mash the mouse and why do I need a warlock when I can easily pick up the best gun in seconds. You are most likely to pick classless as your only class because of the variety of options you have and with a decent amount of health. There's probably no reason to pick the other classes unless you want the achievements. 

[u]Artificial intelligence[/u] 
The ai in this game is your standard brain dead, go in with numbers sort of guys. They will come in waves in an attempt to kill the player and even then over a hundred of them are already dead. What they make up for is their twitch movements they try to mimic the player making them unpredictable and some of them have a faster or slower attack speed. They all have one health and only carry guns, so it's nothing to talk a lot about, all you need to know that there are hundreds of them to kill. 

[u]Conclusion[/u] 
There's not really a lot to talk about, I usually talk about atmosphere as well and as interesting as it looks it not necessary. The game has very little content but what it makes up for is it's arcade like action. It's a really cheap game that will take you at least close to two hours to get all the achievements and is not for everyone. If you like fast gameplay like the old "Quake" and "DOOM" games get it if you want to. Your not really missing anything out but if you think it looks good buy it, probably get it on sale. If nothing interests you and you want story narrative games go look at "Lisa", "Undertale" or "Oneshot". I even made a review on "Oneshot" so if you want to know what the game is like, go check out the review.
