author: {'steamid': '76561198053788131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1483873084}
review:
[h1]OVERVIEW[/h1]
UBERMOSH (all caps) is a style-over-substance twin-stick shooter with a difference: your best weapon is your sword, which can reflect enemy shots.

The story behind UBERMOSH is limited, but there seems to be a degree of 'lore' surrounding the game and other similar ones by the one-man development team, Walter Machado. I won't try to delve into it other than to say that you play an armoured-up woman with a very big glowing sword and in each short (90-second) game you have to try to survive against hordes of gun-toting enemies.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
Graphics have a retro, pixel-graphic appeal to them. They're okay, but not the best pixel graphics I've seen. Animations are okay, too.

The level graphics are fairly bland and uninspired, but I think it is supposed to be a desert, so I guess that fits. In any case, the background gets splattered with gore fairly quickly.

There are no graphics options -- not even a full screen / windowed toggle -- but I found that ALT-ENTER does work for entering windowed mode, in Windows 10 at least, and from there you can resize the window if you want to.

[h1]Sound[/h1]
The music is really not my thing. A lot of people love it, but I really didn't. Sound effects are okay, and even somewhat useful in helping you get into 'the zone' given the difficulty of the game, but since there are no volume settings, and I don't want to listen to that music anymore, I've had to mute the sound effects while playing as well.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
UBERMOSH is a simple twin-stick shooter played in 90 seconds, if you can survive that long. You're dumped in the middle of a procedurally generated level with nothing but your armour and sword, and very shortly after that the game throws hordes of bad guys, aliens, and who knows what else at you.

Killing an enemy leaves a lovely pool of red slop behind, as well as the enemy's weapon, which you can pick up. There are a few different weapon types, with the best undeniably being a gun that fires five red shots in an arc, covering a fairly good portion of the field in front of you. Unfortunately there's no way to lock a weapon once you've picked it up, and with the battlefield quickly becoming littered with blood, gore, and enemy weapons that you'll unintentionally pick up when you run over them, you won't always be able to hold on to your red death for very long.

And that's basically it. There are a few different modes ('character mods') that provide you with different starting weapons and health ('respawns'), and Steam achievements to aim for if just trying to survive for 90 seconds or beating your previous score isn't enough for you. But there's no advancement or reward for playing other than a sense of satisfaction and relief. There doesn't seem to be any online score keeping or anything like that, either, so some fans have started a 'best score' thread with screenshots in the Steam discussions for the game, in case you want to brag.

There's no zooming in or out and the camera moves with you, keeping you in the centre of the screen. Given the aspect ratio, this means that you have less sight range between your character and the top and bottom of the screen than you do at the sides, so enemies coming from the top or the bottom regularly get the jump on you; you'll often find a run ended by an enemy spewing the five red beams of death at you from one of those directions.

For a game that's obviously focused on reaction time and precision, the controls feel a bit sloppy to me. Playing with a keyboard and mouse is a bit frustrating, but the controller is worse. Stick to keyboard and mouse.

[h1]PROS AND CONS[/h1]
Pros:
+ An interesting setting, but one that's not examined in enough depth
+ It's very hard and unforgiving; some people like that
+ Achievements and trading cards

Cons:
- It's very hard and unforgiving; some people don't like that
- Unpleasant music, with no separate sound/music volume settings
- Controls could be a bit tighter
- No advancement or improvement, just the same thing each time
- Its name is in caps

[h1]CONCLUSION[/h1]
I'm a fan of most things 'cyberpunk' and I love science fiction twin-stick shooters, so I'd had UBERMOSH on my wishlist for a long time. The store page didn't suggest it was anything but a one-hit wonder, so I wasn't disappointed in the lack of depth in the game, but I had been hoping to enjoy the core gameplay more than I did. As far as the 'cyberpunk twin-stick shooter' genre is concerned, UBERMOSH is the game that I've had the least fun playing.

That said, it is what it is and it doesn't try to pretend to be anything else. You can regularly pick it up for just under 50 cents, sometimes including the soundtrack (not that that's a good thing, from my point of view), so it's also the cheapest game that I've played in the genre.

Given the discounted price and subject matter, it's hard to not recommend UBERMOSH in spite of its shortcomings. But be aware: it's difficult, repetitive, more frustrating than it could be, and there's really not much to it. 

[h1]5/10[/h1]

review:
I suck at this game, but my computer sucks even more, so I get slow downs if there are too many enemies on screen, meaning I get sick-ass bullet-time fever to cut teh bullets and rampage through the aliens in the sweetest way possible.

11/10 would play on shitty netbook again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994801267', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1558744968}
review:
Boy, oh boy am I glad that i found this game! In some way, I have been wanting a game like exactly like this, it really tickles something that says to me "yes, you really needed this." and I couldn't agree more.

I guess the best genre for this is bullet hell? There's lots of bullets to dodge and a lot of things to kill, you can cut your enemies bullets with your blade to make them reflect back to their shooters while at the same time multiplying (hence the cut part). There is 3 different class-mods in this one, Kensai, Gunner and Warlock, not counting the default mode.

Superb music imo, and the artstyle makes me imagine some kind of cyberpunk setting especially form the main menu art from all 3 UBERMOSH games, that is certainly what made me look twice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061795684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1504409769}
review:
[h1]My wristle hurts, my fingers hurts, my hand hurts. Everything hurts, even my ego.[/h1]
10/10 Original piece but based on Arcade roots. Hard is an understatement, and this is the ''easier'' of the series. The pace and the flow reminds me of [b]Smash TV[/b] mixed with [b]Cannon Fodder[/b] which had [b]Space Mega Force[/b] babies and they had mutated relatives like [b]Total Carnage.[/b] The diference is that you can't just be a powerup swapper and loose gunner. There are brillant yet simple tactical choices to make before you hit for your advantage, from swords only, Handicap balance and to gunner, these classes adds lots of fun.

[h1]A very important game to ever happen to the category on Steam.[/h1]
I've found out that the game was made single handedly by the dev, and the music track was composed by the man! Music here is dope, the main star on my opinion pure and simple.

Game isn't stage based, which I have suggested to add in the past, this game can worn off quickly without that. As this is an indie game you should expect a bit lack of balance on combat, A.I. is kinda predictable at some point but It's pretty addictive regardless. I told people this game would have a future when it came out and I was right. Those things got fixed.

[h1]If you don't like Arcade, maybe this is your chance[/h1]
You should also be looking forward for [b]Ubermosh Black, Ubermosh volume 3, SwarmRiders[/b] that would like moving from sweet strawberry gums from here to red hot chili pepper. Hmmm tastes like the 90s. For some reason I like the main title, must be my 80s mode turning on.

Just make sure you got a fast DPI on your mouse and don't forget to cut the bullets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013282689', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1483396519}
review: It has a hard learning curve until you read some guides and it gets better. As you gain skill you see the beauty, deflections alone is my favorite class. It can be summed up as an arcade-like high score oriented game. The same 90 second round over and over with a few class mod varients and a hard mode that's actually the easier to score mode. Good little game but try to nab it on sale since it's a very small package of content. If you enjoy going deep on a game that starts off simple, like Geometry Wars, this is a good game to check out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087062700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1498218025}
review:
90 seconds, enemy moving in from all sides, and you with a blade to cut bullets in half and perhaps a gun (if the class you select allows it). Sounds easy, right? 

Ubermosh is one of those games I play periodically because it can be a great deal of fun, and it is also one of those games I find myself enraged by, You are spawned into an area with a specific amount of 'respawns' or hits you can take, and you have specific abilities depending on the class you select. This means you can start with a sword only, an automatic gun only,  and mictures in-between. Your health is also adjusted depending on what you select, and this makes it a lot more difficult. 

I picked up the set on the winter sale for a really cheap price, and that makes it worthwhile. The second and third one are fun, and the third removes a lot of the landscape in the game and literally hits you with enemies only. There is also a version that has you on a bike, shooting stuff (i cannot recall the name of it, but I'm not a huge fan). It is fun, and amazing how much time you end up burning in 1 1/2 bursts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106393807', 'num_games_owned': 1097, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1483185210}
review:
UBERMOSH ist ein extrem schneller "Shooter" - mit ein paar interessanten Ideen. Es spielt in einem Cyberpunk Universum und ist im Arcadestil gehalten.

[h1]Grafik[/h1]
Die Grafik ist, wie bei einem Arcade-Titel zu erwarten ist, sehr verpixelt. Das passt bei UBERMOSH besonders gut, da man sich so auf das Wesentliche konzentrieren kann. Desweiteren wirkt so das Blut der Gegner deutlich mehr als ein Teil des Hintergrunds, den man ausblenden kann.
[b]9/10[/b]

[h1]Sounddesign[/h1]
Die Musik ist ebenfalls passend, wenn auch etwas monoton auf Dauer. Die Kampfsounds sind - wie die Hintergrundmusik - sehr laut. Gut gelungen und ein toller Soundtrack.
[b]8/10[/b]

[h1]Story[/h1]
"The colony provides us everything. Except violence, that we still find in the deserts of Uldakaar".
UBERMOSH hat keine wirkliche Story. Im Tutorial wird lediglich auf die Kolonie hingewiesen, welche alles bieten kann, abgesehen von Gewalt - an der es in diesem Spiel keinen Mangel gibt. Da eine Story hier nicht notwendig ist, werde ich keine Bewertung vornehmen.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Man bewegt sich mit WASD und feuert mit der linken Maustaste, die rechte Maustaste dient dem wichtigsten Feature - das Zerschneiden der feindlichen Kugeln, welche reflektiert werden. Das Ziel ist einen neuen Highscore aufzustellen, eine Runde dauert maximal 60 Sekunden. Es gibt mehrere Klassen zur Auswahl, die alles von nur Schwert und keiner Waffe und nur Waffe und keinem Schwert bieten. Der weitere Modus "Hardboiled" ("Hartgekocht") hat einen separaten Highscore. Es gibt keine Integration mit dem Steam Leaderboard.
[b]10/10[/b]

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
UBERMOSH macht was es soll - und das macht es gut. Angesischts des niedrigen Preises kann ich dieses Spiel voll empfehlen. 
[b]9/10[/b]

Diese Rezension wurde von einem Kurator bei Canis Majoris verfasst.
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/CanisMajorisReviews]Canis Majoris[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198125294466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1479445277}
review: UBERMOSH is a arcade style shooter/swordplay, i find it very highly addictive due to trying to beat my highscores over and over! It is also very tactical by trying to shoot/slash/dodge all at once. UBERMOSH is a beautifully done masterpiece, i really recommend the UBERMOSH Collection. There's no sense in biting half of a delicious cookie when you can have a whole bundle instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143875641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1454814050}
review:
works GREAT with the steam controller if you're lazy on the couch as I am sometimes, but don't expect the highest of highscores.

I'm a big believer in reliving the glory of arcade setting games, where you have your friends breathing down your neck, helping you pop in quarters before the timer determines the fate of your current high score, I'm a big fan of these arcade games.

Uber mosh is unlike any arcade game you've encountered.

 but you cannot compare it as precise to the old school keyboard and mouse. the reaction time depends on your level of skill which will be tested every blink of your soulfull little eyes, you'll be ripping through attacks (bullets kill you mostly on the first direct hit) and the enemies are as unpredictable as they come. 

If you're a fan of the old' school arcade stick controller era as much as I was, pick this up with the soundtrack, the music on this is underrated and there's no shame on spending the extra pennies on the soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352848756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1482232415}
review: A really fun arcade game, slick responsive controls. Challenging achievements and fast paced gameplay that will get your heart racing. author: {'steamid': '76561197970538611', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1481603251}
review:
Way too difficult. Never survived for more than twenty seconds and never felt like I was getting "better". Could honestly not play this game for more than a few minutes at a time because of how discouraged it made me feel-- something few if any games have ever done. It also didn't help that I often seemed to take damage for no reason, even after performing a successful counter. I despise the way the game dumps you back to the main menu the millisecond you run out of continues; not even a score screen or anything. Feels lazy. 

It's a shame, because the minimalist art design and catchy soundtrack are really well done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065291025', 'num_games_owned': 1121, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1510344614}
review:
TLDR.; BUY IT NOW!!!!! you won't regret it
I bought this game and it's OST for 0.48 euros. Hands down my BEST arcade buy thus far in my life. I'd even buy it for twice the ORIGINAL price now. Pretty much capped out the achievements in 4 hours, but I think that only happened because I have played a lot of bullet hells before. Back to the review, this is a game with a simple enough control scheme, a kick ass soundtrack, fast gameplay, there are no things against it, but here are some MINOR annoyances that might or might not come up:
-the hitboxes take some time to get used to
-as well as the movement speed of the character
-there are some cases of cheap deaths, especially in the beginning (when the screen scrolls vertically and enemies appear and fire instantly, and initially you don't know how to react, so you are forced to take a hit, but you'll soon learn how to counter this.)
This is a MUST for all bullet hell or arcade fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043938077', 'num_games_owned': 1738, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1511003919}
review:
UBERMOSH is a great arcade twin-stick bullet hell shooter with a cyberpunky retro aesthetic. I recommend this game to anyone who likes pick-up and play games with a good dose of challenge, personality and a classic feeling to them.

It's very basic; you get put into an area with endless enemies and you want to try to get as many kills as you can within 90 seconds or until you run out of lives. You can pick up any of the guns the enemies drop, and slice enemy shots with your sword to split them and send them back. It's simple, but fantastic and satisfying. The guns really feel like they pack a punch because of their sound effects and a minor screen shake whenever you shoot. 

You can somewhat change the experience by changing class mod, which can either take away your sword but give you rapid fire, or take away your ability to shoot so you have to rely on cutting enemy bullets as your only means of attacking. There isn't a whole lot of variety in the content, but if you like this content you can easily play it for hours on end, or keep it installed to play from time to time when you've got some minutes to kill. It's also got the right amount of challenge, since it has a learning curve and is unforgiving from the start, but once you get the hang of the gameplay and patterns it's doable and just a blast.

It's definitely worth the 2 bucks it goes for, and during a sale it will be a steal. Grab the pack, even, and get several great games for nearly no money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195298155', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1480606174}
review:
[b] *ATTENTION* 
Do NOT buy it if you suffer from epilepsy [/b] 
(pretty obvious, but better safe than sorry)


The game concept is pretty simple: you'll keep on shooting, dying, respawning (repeat forever) but it will be so damn fun to see your improvements once you'll start to understand how to survive.


Very very very cheap and beautiful, imo you won't be disappointed if you're into the bullet hell genre. I suggest to buy the bundle with the whole series, it's really worth it.
If you're not sure yet, you can give SWARMRIDERS a try, which is a free short game from the series that will give you a general idea about what you're gonna face (even though it reminds only of Ubermosh's gunner mode)

author: {'steamid': '76561198330759968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1544164098}
review: I love this game! It can be quite frustrating at first, but with practice, the movement, speed, accuracy and timing become more fluid. At one point I focused on how my fingers and mouse hand were functioning and coordinating so precisely and I was amazed. There is a learning curve, but eventually you'll mosh like a boss. So glad I've experienced this game and definitley recommend it to anyone who loves a difficult, fast=paced experience. I forgot to mention the awesome soundtrack. There, I mentioned it. It awesome! Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198105332516', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1478332816}
review:
Me basto jugar 3 partidas para encantarme el juego y a la vez ver un error tan grande que si lo arreglan sera muy disfrutable, ALEJEN LA CAMARA POR EL AMOR DE DIOS, no se si es que el juego es tan simple que necesitaron acercar la camara hasta el punto de que cuando aparecen los enemigos no te da tiempo de reaccionar, bueno, uno si, pero de repente aparecen 10 en pantalla a la vez y es practicamente imposible esquivar, talvez eso es lo que querian los desarrolladores, no lo se, pero el unico objetivo es sobrevivir lo maximo posible en un mapa donde la dificultad esta basada en el numero de enemigos que literalmente te es imposible ver venir en un determinado momento, el problema es que nada te incita a seguir jugando, las partidas duran tan poquito y cuando pierdes no sientes que sea por que te falte habilidad, que si, pero no se siente, por la camara que te limita la vision.

YA NI SIQUIERA ES QUE EL JUEGO SEA FRUSTANTE, ES QUE DIRECTAMENTE CUANDO LO JUEGAS UNAS 10 VECES PARECE QUE YA LO JUGASTE TODO

Por ejempo, en velocibox es tambien un juego super rapido y las partidas duran nada, pero cuando pierdes te queda la sensacion de que sabes que no reaccionaste a tiempo, en este juego ni siquiera me queda claro si llegado un punto algo va a cambiar aparte de la cantidad de enemigos que es obvio, pero bueno, el juego por el precio se merece un recomendado, pero es tan simple su problema y tan facil de arreglar que no lo recomendare, pero si te sobra el dinero, y no te tiene que sobrar mucho, yo lo compre a 5 pesos mexicanos, que es menos de medio dolar, pues compralo y pruebalo por ti mismo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176364758', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1486978220}
review: It's a really fun game which reminds me of the games i used to play on our old pc like Crimsonland, smash tv etc. needs alot of hand and eye coordination when the bullet storm occurs, worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096713277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1478239053}
review:
This game is everything people say it is. Action, bullets, and swords. The game sounds nice and feels really smooth to play however due to that smoothness I felt like there wasn't any real feedback wich will bring me to my next point.

Although the game is good, and is a must have if you like old school arcade games or bullet hell shooters, the thing that really turns me off is the feedback.

I like to really get into the games I play but here with the slippery movement, and seemingly random deaths I just can't do that. I really hope that this game will see some patches to address the feedback issue about getting hit. Plus the way it just suddenly shows you a game over screen just feels hacky. (Although maybe the intent is to make you rage, so you can get going.)

However I am still going to recommend this game because at this price it's a steal. (CDN$0.49 at the time of purchase.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198056739666', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1480115079}
review:
I can happily say that UBERMOSH is one of the most entertaining games I have played in a while. In this game, your objective is to survive in a mosh pit for 1 minute and 30 seconds, using your laser sword to reflect the enemies' bullets back into them, making up for a great defense mechanism, and to eventually pick up their guns and start your own carnage in the pit. 
The retro art style is lovely and really matches the game's theme while the soundtrack is amazingly energizing, fueling your space killing-sprees. There are several arenas in which you can fight ( randomly chosen by the game when you start a new run), but the only difference between them is the colour of the environment. Your arsenal is not really big but it is varied and has lots of uses: besides your sword, you can equip up to 5 (aproximate number) guns that are dropped by the endless incoming waves of enemies, each having different fire modes ranging from a shotgun to a single charged shot or a flurry of bullets widespread in a cone of fire. 
The game comes with 4 combat modes: the ordinary one, in which you have 3 lives and can use your sword and any gun you pick up; the "kensai" mode, in which you cannot pick up any firearms, relying only on your sword and starting the run with 6 lives; the "gunner" mode, in which you have no sword but any gun you pick up fires in a full-auto mode; or "warlock", in which you start with the best gun in the game and can use your sword, but you get only 2 lives. 
If you're looking forward to a greater challenge than what the base game has to offer, hardboiled mode is here to satisfy your needs, representing a much difficult twist on the base game that resets your overall score when you switch to it.
You can also get trading cards and easy-to-obtain achievements when playing the game, which adds to the value and makes the price worth it. In my opinion, UBERMOSH will not let you down if you're looking for a good time-killer or just for some good old top down shooting action, and I would strongly suggest buying it.

TL;DR: With a difficulty level that reminisces good old arcade games, UBERMOSH brings some new elements to the retro top down shooter template, and it will get you a decent 2 or 3 hours of fun for a really good price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068823752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1506586898}
review: The game is ok. It is very fast paced, and easy to get into. It is brutally difficult. Normally this isn't an issue for me, but your hit box is so enormous that enemy bullets will spawn inside it counting as automatic hits. This makes the game frustratingly unfair as any enemy within a short range can and will score unavoidable hits on you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128395991', 'num_games_owned': 1128, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1471680111}
review:
UBERMOSH, an extremely simple, yet balls to the wall hard game with an amazing rocking soundtrack & a top-down view of the action. Story is simple & quick to the point, cyberpunk utopian future colony where violence, crime & poverty is a non-issue but violence is a â€œbasic needâ€, so what better way to blow off much needed stress than dropping you in a hostile environment. That is basically it, you are armed with a sword, which you can use to deflect enemy bullets back at them or slice them. Guns are dropped by enemies, simply running over them picks them up. The guns are nothing special, each have their own bullet spread and there is a total of 5 different guns. The game has a simple premise, basically your difficult to survive horde/score attack type of game. You are given 90 seconds & 4 lives on the basic mode of play. There are 4 modes or class mods as the game call them: Kensai, limits you to only use your sword, Gunner only guns & Warlock, which gives you the â€œbestâ€ gun as well as the being able to use your sword. Your amount of lives varies between each mod. Gunplay is average serving more to thin the numbers rather than being your main method of attack, the sword being your main weapon & â€œshieldâ€, with its ability to deflect bullets, against the onslaught. Despite the enemy bullets coming in hard & fast, they are brightly neon colored so you have a decent chance of being able to evade/deflect them.

Ubermosh can be played with both a mouse/kb & controller. It does not feature a graphical setting menus or any other menu for that matter. The game is extremely short considering it doesnâ€™t really have story to tell & consists of nothing more than fighting the horde of enemies for 90 seconds or your death. There was a minor flaw involving the walls, in which having you move next to them it just stops your movement & gets you stuck to them which is an annoyance in such a fast paced game. No leaderboards as well, so you will have to resort to sharing score the old fashioned way.  All in all, despite that minor flaw, it is a decent time waster with a pretty cool soundtrack that will have you head banging along to the beat as you slice & dice your way through the horde..

author: {'steamid': '76561198135389709', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1475721977}
review:
Sadly, i cannot recommed Ubermosh, as much as i wanted to.
When i first saw it, the thoughts of "its smash tv + cyberpunk, what could possibly go wrong?" crossed my mind; but wonky hitboxes, unprecise movements, gigantic bullets that are difficult to deflect/dodge and the complete lack of content makes this a game that should have been free on Newgrounds...and even then, its a 15 minutes curiosity at best.

I will have to praise the soundtrack at the very least.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978564782', 'num_games_owned': 1417, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1475246034}
review:
tldr; great game, easily worth the full price.  Some wonkyness in terms of bullet spawn and hitboxes, but it's consistent and predictable with some practice, and fun from the start.


[b][u]My take[/u][/b]
If you consider yourself a twitch gamer, this gem will test your mettle.  If you consider yourself patient, this game will cause you to re-evaluate.  If you like a challenge, the achievements associated are a feather for your cap (especially Kensai CM).

This game has stones - big ones.  And rage.  And an awesome soundtrack.

Games last 90 seconds or less - if you're a winner it'll end at 90 seconds no matter what.  Short, simple, video arcade runs are the only thing this game is; variations include random spawn, 4 class mods (CMs), 5 types of gun (sounds low but it's more than enough), and a couple of different maps (always random).

There is some predictability to enemy movement but they'll surprise you, too.  A small visible area  is a *feature* of the game designed to make it twitchy, but to compensate, bullets move slow enough that you can [i]almost[/i] outrun them... but not quite.  In other words, it's balanced.

VERY nice work, devs!

[u]Pros:[/u]
~Controls are both simple and intuitive
~Game action is smooth and uniterrupted
~Excellent soundtrack, appropriate to game action
~Game has NEVER crashed or glitched in ~13 hours play

[u]Cons:[/u]
~Some will find hitboxes glitchy, but it can be learned and compensated for
~Some will not like bullet spawn being in front of the gun, rather than enemy giving indication of firing
~Some will not like minor screen shake upon being hit by enemy fire
~Player cannot slide along walls, meaning, you can't move diagonally in the direction of a wall that you're already touching; you have to clear the wall first

***A note as to the "Cons" - having a dozen hours of playtime invested, I have found these things to be [i]features,[/i] rather than negatives, because they are predictable and one can adjust play to compensate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014926595', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 967, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1569551399}
review:
(Special thanks to Spookymcslave to providing this game.  Thanks, man.  :) )

[h1]You walk into the arena to hear the crowd cheering before you witness an army before you.  Were they cheering for a mountain of bodies or your head on a pike?[/h1]

[i]UBERMOSH[/i] is an arcade-style arena game with minimal story and plug-and-play action with 4 playstyles to choose from and challenging achievements.  Overall, it was pretty fun.

As stated before, [i]UBERMOSH[/i] is by no means easy, but it is possible to complete within 90 minutes (about as long as it took me while watching the first presidential debate of 2016).  Scoring high while overwhelmed in an arena that's almost danmaku-like can be quite a challenge, especially while more and more troops spawn in, firing their weapons at you (Hope you've been practicing your [i]Touhou[/i]).  The gameplay is said to randomly generate arenas too, though I'm not sure if they're truly random or if there's simply a library of arenas in which one pre-made arena is chosen.  Either way, the randomized(?) arena gives this title more replayability.

The music to this game is awesome, the graphics look sweet, and the gameplay is solid, making this a positive experience even if the difficulty is ramped up.  The girl on the title screen also isn't bad to look at either. (in my opinion, at least)

Now, the game is ordinarily priced at $2, but when it goes on sale, it only costs $0.50, which feels to be a fair price.  I highly recommend grabbing this when it goes on sale.

8/10  A retro-style arena shooter that is worth your time.  How many lives will you claim before yours is claimed as well?

Un juego bastante divertido, muy muy frenetico y si te quieres echar unas risas pues pillate el kensai, y muere 250 millones de veces...
aun asi no da mucho juego, una vez completas los 7 logros se acaba, pero tiene cromos lo cual le da puntitos extra.
Compralo, es divertido y el equilibrop de Precio/horas de juego esta bastante bien.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066707252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1592876367}
review:
Pros:
-Awesome adrenaline rush
-Cool type of game (overhead pixel shooter)
-Cool game mechanic (swords deflecting bullets)
-More than one class to switch it up
-Competetive achievements

Cons:
-Probably not much replay value, I bought it an hour ago and played it the whole time and plan on going back but I can see myself not putting over 10 hours on it, probably in 15-60 min sessions.

8.5/10
I love this game. I paid a dollar for it, thanks to a 50% off coupon from a badge, and instantly got an hour of gameplay out of it. I always thought if I can get an hour per dollar spent on a game, it's worth it and this game nailed that on the head.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995061416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1472614697}
review:
Can't recommend this one. Repetitive, with little replay value.

Multiple character classes kept me coming back to it, but the core game just isn't there. It's fast, bright, and flashy, sure, but it really boils down to running from one end of the map to the other, slicing up the same few randomly spawning enemies.

Some of the mechanics are pretty cool, slicing enemy bullets to launch them back at the enemy is pretty satisfying the first few times you do it, but it's not something to hold an entire game up.

The shooting's a headache. Firing shakes the screen so much that it more often than not disoriented me to the point of losing track of my character and running face-first into my death. I stuck mainly to the sword after that.

Enemies spawn around the map at random. There's no set pattern or waves. Any high-scoring round I played felt to me more like a stroke of luck than an accomplishment.

I paid fifty cents for this game, and I'm still considering a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976104660', 'num_games_owned': 992, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1486596104}
review:
one of the dankest arcade games you'll ever play
fun as hell, 90 seconds of blissful mayhem
also one of the hardest arcade games you'll ever play
if you're familiar with trying to get the 250k score trophy on Kung Fury: Streets of Rage
then Ubermosh will be right at home for you. Not for the sluggish and slow of reflex.
Music is amazing too, every gun blast adds a kick to the beat and the blood doesn't stop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257824599', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1527191019}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013343682', 'num_games_owned': 975, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1561860391}
review:
I like the game, but steam sees reccomendation as black and white, and looking at the current score (92%) I think this game doesn't deserve such a high note. But whatever I guess I am going to have to stick to this system...

Pro :
-Music is really cool, I like how it evolves arround the same instrument
-Gameplay overall is really cool and fun
-really simple and easy to pick up
-cheap
-doesn't ACTUALLY need 512 mb of gpu, you can play it on anything pretty much .

Con :
-Getting an ennemy spawn and shoot you instantly
-melee and ranged weapon takes time to switch (so you will press fire ranged weapon, then melee weapon and it won't work, which sucks because this is a fast paced game, and there shouldn't be a delay between the two)
-And as some other people said before the camera could be placed farther away, or better yet, ajustable.
-lack of diversity
-no way to return to main menu with a controller

Yes, the game is simple, lack game modes and such, plus it only has 4 class mods, but it only costs two dollars, when not 75% off on a steam sale, which makes it 0.50$. For that price, this is an excellent game I would give it a solid 85%.

Note : This game is a score attack obviously, you will die constantly, if you are the kind of person who doesn't enjoy this, don't consider this game, unless you have an extra 0.50% and that you don't know what to do with it, you should just keep it honestly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102975449', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1481459278}
review:
This game provides great entertainment in small bursts of 90 seconds with a resonable price of 2$.

Visually, the game is heavily inspired by cyberpunk themes. Colorful sprites, striking menu artwork and even the font all help bringing its Sci-fi asthetics home. Most of the tracks in the OST are heavily inspired by heavy metal, featuring distorted guitar riffs and crisp drum-and-bas that never fails to get your blood pumping hand your head banging.

Gameplay wise, Ubermosh takes place in the Ultakaar desert. You have one goal, and one goal only: SURVIVE. Right off the bat, the game's flaws began to rear its ugly head: enveloping the desert is the enemy spawnpoint, referred ingame as Extraction Zone. The player will be kicked to the menu after staying in this area for a certain amount of time. This creates a surprisingly small playground for the player to maneuver. In keeping with the small scale theme, the weapon roster is fairly humble. The most basic weapon in the game is the sword. This weapon is especially effective because all enemies in the game dies in one hit, either of their own bullets or strike of your sword, and bullets penetrate indefinitely. There are only 5 ranged weapons in Ubermosh. Most of them are fun to use in their own rights, with each having different bullet patterns. But once you get your hands on the best weapon in the game, you'll find yourself never using other weapons ever again. This is made difficult by the fact that, once you walk pass a gun dropped by an enemy, your character will automatically pick it up and use it. Avoiding unwanted weapons on the floor now becomes an active gameplay element as a result. Ubermosh is heavily dependent on reflexes. Enemies spawns are randon and usually outside of your viewing range. There are no visual indicators to suggest impending enemy fire, which makes dodging and reflecting bullets immensly challenging and heavily dependent on luck. Ubermosh provides players with the option of different modifications of your character. There is "Kensai" mode, where the only weapon the player could use is the sword. Being the opposite, "Gunner" mode completely remove the sword, leaving the player with the ability to shoot all guns automatically. "Warlock" mode gives the character the best weapon in the game and the sword, along with significantly reduced HP (reffered as "Respawns" in game). The game could also be switched to Hardboiled Mode, increasing the number of enemies in a level. Controls in Ubermosh are simple, snappy, responsive and perfectly serves the purpose of the game, a straightfoward arcade shooter. 

To wrap this review up, Ubermosh is an immensly entertaining game, especially for its price. Although it's flaws are quite glaring, the core gameplay is fun enough to make you forget about them. A great game to spend 90 seconds of your life on.

review:
This game is great.  Old school gameplay; repeated failures don't incite my vitriol and anger like on some games.  Maybe that is because this game lays it all out on the table for ya, you play it on its terms.

Highly recommended.

Also, the soundtrack is dope.  If I had to describe it, I'd say AcidRockabilly Techno Metal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174487591', 'num_games_owned': 1829, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1472218612}
review:
In 90 seconds of life, this game offer the high doze of adrenaline rush.

Gameplay is simple, you can cut enemy bullet by your blade. Take enemy weapon, shot them. Get bigger weapon, kill them all as a soldier. Or become a master ninja who only equip blade to cut the bullet. In 90 seconds of life, this ain't easy to survive. Good reflex is the most requirement. And why this game is great on my book, because of its amazing soundtrack. It is perfectly blend with the gameplay that require a mood, adrenaline rush and good reflex.

Last word, if you want a simple game and had a challenge to test your reflex. I recommended this fantastic game, worthed of your time. Get full price to support developer or highly discount too if you want save money. It is worthed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182233446', 'num_games_owned': 924, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1471889135}
review:
Pros:
+Fun,challenging top-down shooter
+Soundtrack
+Price
+Diffrent gamemodes and mods to change gamestyle of the game
+Pixel graphics fit the game nicely

Meh:
=There could be a bit more story 
=There isn't a lot of content in the game

Cons:
-When changing gamemodes your high score resets for some reason
-When the enemy shoots the bullet doesn't come out of his gun but reather appears a bit in front of him. This is quite frustrating because sometimes when you are close to the enemy you my die from a bullet you didn't even see.

Final Verdict 8/10

Ubermosh is a fun little game that I can recommend buying on a sale which is a bit greedy but the game (even for it's price) has only about 15-30 minutes of entertaiment.

review:
Se trata de un juego de acciÃ³n indie en el que tendremos que sobrevivir a hordas de enemigos. Para ello, contamos con nuestra espada y las armas que dejan los enemigos o que recibimos si elegimos una de las clases permitidas al inicio de la partida, y que nos dan ventajas a cambio de "puntos de vida".

La jugabilidad es rÃ¡pida y directa, tenemos que esquivar los disparos enemigos o partirlos con la espada golpeando en el momento adecuado. La cobertura del escenario tambiÃ©n serÃ¡ importante para sobrevivir los 90 segundos del asalto.

Pros:
Buena mÃºsica, estÃ©tica pixel de los tiempos de la Amiga500 de estilo ciberpunk.
Contras:
Escenarios siempre iguales, poca variedad de enemigos.

Resumen:
Si lo puedes comprar a menos de 1â‚¬ vale la pena para echar unas partidas, ademÃ¡s, puedes completar la insignia con facilidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306433120', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1585247451}
review:
[b]UBERMOSH[/b] es un juego arcade casual en donde tenemos 90 segundos para sobrevivir ordas de enemigos sin evitar perder nuestras vidas. Es un juego relativamente corto, complicado, pero no imposible. Su mecÃ¡nica es simple, usamos nuestra espada para atacar y cortar (regresar) las balas enemigas hasta que se acabe el tiempo, o hasta que nos maten dentro de una zona limitada.  AdemÃ¡s cuenta con tres clases (Kensai, Gunner y Warlock) que nos harÃ¡ un poquito mÃ¡s desafiante el juego sin contar el modo "Hardboiled" que es su modo difÃ­cil. Por Ãºltimo, creo que una de las cosas mÃ¡s destacables del juego es su soundtrack, puede parecer un poco repetitivo a veces pero es pegadizo y va muy bien con eso de rebanar oponentes. 

Es un juego ideal para echar una partida de vez en cuando. Y con el precio que tiene, es casi un robo de nuestra parte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037958977', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1471201796}
review:
Biggest concern is the camera bounds; the issue you face in any widescreen top-down shooter is that you can see much farther to the left and right than you can from the top and bottom. Ubermosh is pretty zoomed in, with that limitation plus how far towards the edge of the screen you can get when you're traveling to the top or bottom, you end up walking straight into enemies just as you first see them.

I like the quick decisions between firing or slicing, I like the music changes on respawn. I wish the attacks were less random, perhaps starting at a specific distance from the player and repeating constantly at that enemie's given fire rate while the player is inside it's radius. That and zoom out a bit and this mght be a pretty good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027819327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1472917018}
review:
What can I say about Ubermosh.

I've got it in the steam summersale.
It was kind of an impulse buy, like when you're in the
music store buying a heavy metal album from its cover art.

The soundtrack is superb. And while there are plenty of
games waiting in my backlog to be played, Ubermosh
just slided by those. I'm enjoying it as much as I'm bad
at it, and I'm enjoying it very much.

It's the sort of fast paced action you can put in between
longer games, or when you've got some minutes to spare. It 
has enough variation to keep you entertained. And challenged!

When I have been going at it with a class for about five times,
I switch to another. The differences between the classes give
you a change of approach to refuel your reflexes, when you
are trying the melee class the next time.

I've grown too old for bullet hell games.
Ubermosh has a hell of a lot of bullets flying around.
But it's the first time in a while I'm enjoying beeing in
the middle of a bullet armageddon. This may be 
because this is not quiet bullet hell game,
even though, well, bullets, everywhere.

Ubermosh had me at 
'cutting your enemies' bullets with your sword'

I'm just taking a break to have another go at 
trying to kill 150 enemies with their own
bullets. By cutting them in spreadshots.
And sending em back at them. 

If you are just even slightly interested in this 
game, you'll get a good impression of it in under 
two hours, so I'd recommend giving it a try. 
And refund it, if it's not your cup of tea. 

Happy bullet cutting!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020796334', 'num_games_owned': 850, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1468494917}
review:
[h1]I love it to hate it[/h1]

[b]UBERMOSH[/b] is a small, interesting, frantic arcade game where you have to shoot an reflect bullets with your sword. And that's it. I just told you the whole idea of the game.

But that's not the problem. UBERMOSH is quite interesting having a unique soundtrack and art style as well is really interesting and challenging gameplay. Even though there's not much to do in the game [spoiler](got 100% of Achievements in 1.9 hours)[/spoiler] it's still fun to play. I really like games that require fast reflexes and decision making because UBERMOSH really succeeds in that.

Unfortunately the good things stop there. Even though UBERMOSH was fun to play despite the repetitive gameplay it had more flaws in the game mechanics in the short amount of gameplay. The camera is way too close for you to react to anything that's a couple of meters away from you and the hitboxes and spawn points are glitchy... That's the real problem of the game. The enemy bullets will spawn in front of the gun. Not from the barrel of the gun which makes it very hard to predict when to reflect the bullets because you'll be already taking damage before you could even see the bullets. This combined with the extremely glitchy hitboxes makes the gameplay incredibly annoying.

Persoanlly I think that the game is super easy if you fix these problems which then leaves one question... Is the game flawed? Yes. Does it have potential? Yes. A lot. The mechanics are fun and the fast speed of the game makes it fun to play but just because the mechanics are glitchy and flawed there's really no reason to buy this game. If they would be refined UBERMOSH could be one of the best Arcade shooters of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147693983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1469005232}
review:
UBERMOSH is quite a game, I could describe it as a some sort of arcade Sci-fi  monster hell in which the main character wields a sword that can deflect bullets and you can grab the enemy's pistols for your own use.
The main goal is to survive for 90 seconds, you would say that is easy piecy but it isn't, the game is really hard and unforgiving, at the beginning you will survive less than 30 seconds, but the more you play it you develop an strategy to finally do it.

The graphics and it's optimization is well made and it aims to its purpose, the controls are responsive without a doubt, the only way you are going to die is by your own hand.

But you may be question me: "IS THAT IT?" and i can answer you with a "Yes and No"

UBERMOSH has several mods to play which consist on the normal mode, a mode where you can use only your sword, another that you can use only your pistol and a difficult mod that you can use your sword and the most powerful gun but you can only get hit twice, besides that you can change the difficulty to hardboiled mode which is harder.

But by the time you establish your strategy you have pretty much defeated the game with all of its mods (or at least that's what happened to me), and I'm not saying that is poorly designed, [i] au contraire mon ami	[/i], the game is well done but at least for me the challenge lasted about 30 minutes until I decided to get all of the achievement.

At the end of my review I would say that UBERMOSH is quite an entertaining game made for people who likes challenges,  on relation to it's value you won't feel defrauded with what you get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141197204', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1468036838}
review:
TL; DR - Fun and fast-paced game where you use blade to cut bullet from robotic AK-47.

Great time-waster that takes place in a futuristic, cyber-punk reality where killing things is (legal) entertainment.

You play as some badass grill with a fergalicious sword that she can use to CUT BULLET by right clicking. 
You murder aliens and other humans to take their guns in order to murder more aliens and other humans.

Each gun has a different type of bullet, be it large and firing one at a time or small, spread, and firing three at a time. There is a total of four (maybe five, I'm 90% sure it's four.) gun types, one of which can only be acquired by killing the big aliens.
You'll be able to tell by the yellow blood.
This gun is the strongest, as it shoots the most BULLET at a time.

The main objective of the game is trying to kill as many enemies as possible before you take too many hits or run out of time.
Your weapon selection and weapon attributes can be changed with class mods, which can be selected before you start playing.

Warlock gives you the best gun right off the bat and doesn't let you change it. You can be hit three times.

Gunner removes your ability to use your sword, but makes all your weapons auto-fire, making them shoot while you hold down the mouse button. You can be hit four times.

Kensai removes your ability to use guns, leaving you to only using your sword. You can be hit six times.

There's also this thing where you can change your gamemode to "Hardboiled" which I'm assuming makes it harder but I personally haven't noticed any difference.

I reccomend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980988545', 'num_games_owned': 1381, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1467703482}
review:
I realize everyone has there own opinions and preferences, but I seriously cannot understand how this game has a 90% positive rating from over 600 people. This is the kind of free flash game that you would see on Newgrounds.

One major problem is that the game is zoomed in so far that you cannot see what is happening around you. As you walk in any direction, you get even closer to that edge of the screen which gives you even less time to react when an enemy or projectile pops onto the screen. If you could see more of the game, you may be able to use a bit of strategy instead of just having swarms of enemies rush you from all sides with little to no notice before getting hit.

Also, there is no substance at all. You are in a bland arena with a few barriers scattered around and you can shoot or swing your sword. There are about 4 different guns, but they are all basically the same thing with the better ones shooting more projectiles at once. You basically just spam as many bullets as you can for 90 seconds and try to kill as many enemies as possible. It's best to spam bullets in all directions because you cannot see very far and if you do not kill the enemies that are approaching off screen, they will run you over from all sides.

I liked how the art style of the game looked and it sounded promising with all the positive reviews, but there is literally nothing to this game. There is no progression, almost no weapon variance, no levels, no story, no upgrades, there is literally no substance. I could understand if the game was still in early access and these things were going to be added, but it is not.

In it's current state I would not recommend this game to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092029204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1467800929}
review: Just discovered this gem. I fell in love instantly when I discovered there is no Pause feature. It was at that moment I said "Sweet Raptor Jebus, there is no pause... yes this is a REAL bullet hell game!!", as a Bullet Hell adict, I spit in the face of easy modes, save features, and such a silly thing like a pause button, there is no pause in the chaos and death known as True Bullet Hell gaming, don't you dare blink or itch your nose muhahah,it becomes a test of your own will and power over your own body and is a realm meant only for the relentless and hardcore. Indstrial metal thumps harder than Quake 2 tunes and drives the NON STOP violence. Life and Death is a supreme black and white factor in game, you survive by franticly avoiding bullet chaos, perfecting timing by repeling bullets, getting a good gun and trying to hold corners while at the same time avoiding picking up a worse one till it becomes too much and you bail. The art style is great as well. Luck, pure punishment, and a test of skill while making your own split second tactics, Yus, this game will give you Bullet Hell Zen, let go of the false self and simply be within the torrents of Bullets and Chaos. 10/10 Art style is epic as goat teeeets, real sweet stuff. Just wish it had a two player mode, or online co-op function.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963195774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1467363170}
review:
UBERMOSH is more fun than should be allowed for only $2. It does exactly what it sets out to do: "give you a shot of adrenaline in a couple of minutes." You run around and shoot/slice anybody else in the pit for up to 90 seconds. That's it...And it's perfect.

Guns feel appropriately powerful, the sound of your sword deflecting enemy bullets is satisfying, and each enemy you K.O. leaves a little puddle of success so you clearly know they're down. The colors of incoming enemy fire stand out from the background and enemies are highlighted by a bright ring at their feet, which is great because you'll be looking everywhere all at once. The action is challenging but not frustratingly difficult. Even if you fail, you can be back in a new round quickly. The short rounds give you incentive to get out there and brawl without the fear of losing progress.

I spent a [i]long[/i] time eyeing UBERMOSH, which is stupid considering its ridiculously low price tag and the fact that it's perpetually on sale. Don't make my mistakes. Buy UBERMOSH.

Lo he comprado en rebajas por 47 cent y creedme vale la pena la verdad, es un bullet hell muy adictivo y difÃ­cil al principio. A pesar de tener un Ãºnico mapa tiene varios modos de juego entre ellos solo espada, espada y armas con diferentes cantidades de vidas. GrÃ¡ficamente tiene una estÃ©tica de la Ã©poca de los 8 y 16 bits. Tiene varios problemas que pueden ser resueltos con una actualizaciÃ³n: entre ellos que no tiene modo ventana, que no hay algo que te indique que te han daÃ±ado de forma clara ya que hay muchos proyectiles y se pierde la visiÃ³n de la vida, tampoco tiene una animaciÃ³n clara de muerte o de que pases los 80 segundos que tienes que sobrevivir para pasarte el modo de juego. Es simple pero rejugable tanto como quieras. Puedes desestresarte y pasar un rato desahogÃ¡ndote y distrayÃ©ndote simplemente disparando e intentado sobrevivir. AdemÃ¡s rebotar balas con la espada siempre es un plus.

Lo recomiendo? Si, y si lo pillÃ¡is de oferta como yo con mas razÃ³n todavÃ­a.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972202664', 'num_games_owned': 570, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1481831340}
review:
"The colony provides for everything...except for violence..."

UBERMOSH is like a top-down Devil Daggers.  You appear in an arena and are tasked with surviving 90 seconds of relentless onslaught.  90 seconds isn't much, right?  And all of the enemies die in a single hit--how hard could this possibly be?

As it turns out, hard as fucking [i]nails[/i].  Set to a thrumming metal and techno soundtrack (which is easily one of the best things about UBERMOSH), you will die again and again and again.  Fortunately the game subscribes to Edmund McMillen's "Super Meat Boy" model, wherein dying happens quickly and restarts are virtually instantaneous.  This game doesn't want to waste your time--it just wants 90 seconds.

Depending on your class*, you may begin with a sword; use it to relieve an opponent of one of a handful of different firearms.  Some of these weapons are great.  Some aren't so great.  Fortunately (as I previously mentioned) enemies die as quickly as you.  Therefore the best weapons are those that allow you to spread death around fastest.  Within 30 seconds of a single game, you'll have access to every available weapon--pick the one that works best for you.

*[i]There are several unlockable classes that are fundamentally different takes on the same thing:  One can only use a sword, one starts with the best weapon, etc.  And each has a different number of allotted respawns.  They impact the game, but not in a radical way.[/i]

The game is stripped of all but the barest essentials--there's nary a plot, an economy, or an exposition.  UBERMOSH doesn't have time for those sorts of formalities.  And because of that, the game's a great shot of adrenaline whenever you've got more than a couple of minutes to stop and play it.

Who might like this game?  Anybody who wants a no-frills top-down shooter that's hard as hell.  People who love a soundtrack that makes you want to kill, crush, and destroy.  For those who played Devil Daggers and thought, "You know, I wish this game was remade as a twin-stick shooter."  For $1.99 this game is a solid deal; for $0.49--[i]the price of upgrading a burger to a goddamn cheeseburger[/i]--you'd be a fool to skip out on this game.   

PROS
+ Great Soundtrack
+ Super accessible drop-in/drop-out model 
+ Very challenging

CONS
- Lame Steam cards, emoticons, and wallpapers.  Seriously, the wallpapers are just black backgrounds with a circular shape and the emoticons are colored spurts.
- Weapons could use a little more variety

review: Fun, fast-paced,  affordable. These are all points in favour of Ubermosh. I took a chance on this game because it cost next to nothing and I'm glad i did. It's a very simple arcade-style arena survival game. The swordplay is what makes it compelling. It feels great to deflect shots back at your enemies. The character classes also add variety.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072253557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1711887415}
review:
It's a high-octane, heavy-metal-fuelled adrenaline surge. You start out tense, watching your timer tick down as you wait for the first enemy to appear, and then immediately you're frantically dodging and deflecting and firing wildly into a horde of... monsters? Robots? Cyborgs? The 8-bit graphics should be pretty simple to figure out; but honestly I've never had time to take a proper look -- I'm too busy trying to kill everything that moves.

It's a simple and straightforward game with no real catches or snares -- you fight for your life for 90 seconds or as long as you can hold out, and try to beat your score. You can modify your starting loadout/abilities (they're practically the same thing, which isn't a bad thing at all in a game like this -- it's super simple and intuitive), you can increase the difficulty further if you like, and there are a few entirely option badges to aim for if that's your thing. Again, the badges are simple and straightforward; but they're still going to require you to draw on different skillsets and strategies if you want to complete them.

For $2 you get a game which is *exactly* what it looks like on the tin, but still offers the depth that makes it worth coming back. This game isn't trying to be anything more than a fast, hard-hitting bullet hell/arena arcade game; but it works perfectly within that niche so if that's your niche as well then you'll get a good deal here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074006136', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1465669565}
review:
Estoy erecto ;---------->D

Ahora en serio es un juego alucinante para su precio. El gameplay e muy divertido y entretenido.

Lo basico del juego es lo siguiente:
Tienes una espada que devuelve las balas de los enemigos. Cuando matas a un enemigo este pierde su arma. Hay 4 modelos de armas. Cuando consigues la mejor que es como una escopeta que dispara muy amplio no cojes mas armas. Digo que es la mejor porque ademas de que el propio juego lo indica es la que mas balas dispara y la que mas amplio. Da igual lo pequeÃ±as o debiles que parezcan las balas porque matan siempre y a mas de un enemigo.

Ahora entra lo complicado. Cuando tienes muchos enemigos tienes que decir si disparar o acuchillar. Disparar el arma te puede quitar a 4 o 5 enemigos cercanos pero no te permitira acuchillar en casi un segundo (creerme que es mucho). Si matas a alguien disparando creo que el tiempo de volver a disparar se reduce. CREO. Si escojes acuchillar devolveras las balas en un cono bastante amplio, casi 90Âº. Pero puede que no mates a tantos enemigos y si no matas a nadie te quedas rodeado por 10 enemigos que es morir.

El juego incuye unos cuantos retos como conseguir una puntuacion especifica con ciertas clases. Tambien tiene un modo hardcore que reinicia el juego. Aun no lo he probado pero seguramente actualize.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021259036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1464301255}
review:
RÃ¡pido, sencillo, sin historia al pedo y extremadamente divertido.
El minuto y medio mÃ¡s violento de la historia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198790893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1683035137}
review:
I bought this game on sale
I'm not entirely sure if it's worth it's normal price, but it's definitely worth the $.49 I paid for it.

The game is rad. Slicing and dicing bullets, blasting enemies, what more could you want.

The soundtrack goes very well with the gameplay.

Four different classes to choose from each with it's own perks, I found Kensai to be my personal favorite.

It's easy enough to pick up and play and there are achievements that'll keep you going.

The only thing that kind of sucks is that the achievements are pretty easy.

Don't stop until you're a Blade Saint, because there is no stopping in the deserts of Ultakaar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171055098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1485541354}
review:
Absolutly amazing game.
Hardcore grinding with cyberpunk seasoning. A terrific soundtrack, it goes well with the death of my countless enemies.

Only one con: achievements easy to clear, even in hardboiled mode the "blade saint" is not too much a challange. To be honest, the stay alive for the whole event wasn't easy.

Absolutely worth its price.

EDIT: one thing - I played the game for 3 hours, completed all achievements, played in hardboiled, got the "Blade saint" point, but only 1 card drop from the 3... For the instant fun I will surely play this game for some hours, but the 3 card should be already dropped during this first few hours.

EDIT2: ok, thx for Amicus Ignis for pointing out, that for the first 2 hours there is no card drop. It slipped my mind. :) Still, cool game.

review:
Ubermosh Ã© excelente Arcade Game onde vocÃª tem que sobreviver durante 90 Segundos ( Tenho mais de 4h de jogo e ainda nÃ£o consegui :v ) isso faz com que o jogo tenha um Ritmo muito rapÃ­do  o que combina com a trilha sonora que Ã© impressionante, vocÃª joga, joga denovo, e a mÃºsica dÃ¡ vontade de escutar mais. O barulho da espada cortando as balas, com um som de rock por trÃ¡s, dÃ¡ uma batida sem igual ao game.

O Jogo possui 6 modos diferentes e cada um possui sua propria dificuldade (Eu gosto bastante do modo Kansai onde vc sÃ³ tem a espada como arma), Recomendo vocÃª testar todos e ver em qual vocÃª Ã© melhor mas o que me prendeu foi o fato de que o o tempo Ã© pequeno e isso te faz jogar vÃ¡rias vezes pra tentar melhorar seu resultado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075645628', 'num_games_owned': 997, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1462179795}
review:
[b] UBERMOSH [/b] Ã¨ un gioco  arcade dove il vostro obiettivo sarÃ  abbattere piÃ¹ mostri possibili e sopravvivere alla fine della partita. Prima che loro avranno la meglio su di voi.

Vi ritroverete in un arena,con una musica fantastica (che vi consiglio di sentire a tutto volume) e partirÃ  una sessione di gioco frenetica,divertente e complessa.Complessa perchÃ© i mostri sono davvero veloci e dopo pochi colpi sarete morti,quindi all'inizio risulterÃ   difficile finchÃ© non prenderete la mano e vi abituerete alla velocitÃ  di gioco.

Secondo me si ritrova alcune pecche,ad esempio la visuale Ã¨ un po' troppo zoomata e a volte i nemici appaiono dal nulla senza che voi riusciate a vederli in tempo,ma piano piano vi abituerete anche a questo continuando a tentare.La seconda pecca Ã¨ la durata e la poca rigiocabilitÃ ,le sessioni di gioco sono molto corte se riusciste a vivere e purtroppo essendo solo un'arena,stessi personaggi e stesso sistema,dopo averlo finito non lo toccherete piÃ¹,non avendo altro da fare,anche se il gioco contiene pure una modalitÃ  piÃ¹ difficile chiamata Hardboiled che vi darÃ  magari qualche altra ora di gioco,se avete la pazienza di rigiocarlo.

La cosa buona Ã¨ che se siete dei tipi a cui piace finire i giochi al 100% Ã¨ il gioco perfetto. Essendo veloce e complesso,Ã¨ un ottimo gioco da completare e vi regalerÃ  stress e soddisfazioni.

Beh che dire? Preso in offerta  49 centesimi e sono stati soldi spesi bene,durante i saldi lo troverete spesso a poco e vi consiglio di dargli un'occhiata,anche se corto saranno 2 orette di puro rage e frenesia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003142691', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1460383201}
review: Clocked some offline time with this one, though I may return to it soon. It is one of the most approprietely priced and advertised games I've seen on steam. It plays well with an xbox controller and with a mouse & mouse. It's fun and has a decent soundtrack. Honestly it's just a great game for slicing and dicing and it's cheap. It's hard not to recommend because of how cheap it is and how much fun I've had with it. Watch a video of gameplay, if it looks appealing to you, it almost certainly is. If gameplay does not look appealing to you - avoid it. You get exactly what you see.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993538945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1458996281}
review:
Great challenging game to kill a bit of time on, It's pretty similar to games like Robotron or Smash TV. It's frustrating in the first 10 minutes but after about 30 minutes you start to appreciate the challenge.

This game was obviously crafted with love. The soundtrack to this game is awesome. It's like a cross of synthpunk/speed punk from the 80's. The game plays well with both controller or keyboard/mouse.

For the low price it's a great little game to add to your library. But be warned, it's not for the faint hearted. Controllers could get thrown, mice smashed and keyboards destoyed

in the Ubermosh.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996519790', 'num_games_owned': 2271, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1690879426}
review:
That game rocks. I am really happy I found this gem.
Fast and full of action and sound and after 5 minutes you feel better without a bad aftertaste. When you are looking for a "lot of time playing for your buck" you are wrong, but when you have taste for a good mixture of art and action you are right. 
Basically this is THE game that I played 200 seconds (7 roundss or so) the first time, instantly understood everything and still had a good feeling afterwards. That is quite unique, normally when I am done after 200s in the first try it is also the last. Not with ubermosh. Thumbs up and strongly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198278740230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1458253123}
review:
For a little over 2 dollars you can buy a candy bar or a soft drink from a store. However for the same price you can buy a pretty sweet game that goes by the name of Ubermosh.

Similar Games:
CS GO 2D and the Hotline Miami series are what I can think of right off the bat.

Gameplay: 
The rounds start off with a trickle of foes, you might even wonder where's the action? Well no worries, in around 10 seconds the screen will be filled with a deluge of pixel foes who wish nothing more than to delete your sorry ass from the arena. 
To combat these hordes of incoming foes you can choose 3 distinct classes, each with their own playstyle. The classes are Kensai, Gunner, and Warlock. 

The Kensai is the most durable of the three but is restricted to using the blade only. 
The Gunner has no defensive abilities besides dodging bullets, however she gains the ability to go full auto with her guns, like the saying goes, the best defense is a great offense.

 The Warlock gives you the best gun right off the bat and lets you swing your sword, sounds pretty OP right? It is, to a certain extent, but you only have 2 health (Although you can deflect bullets leading to a debate if the Warlock actually is less durable than the Gunner.) 

If you don't want to be restricted by class, running without a class is a good way to get into the flow for Ubermosh.

Pros:

Cheap
Faced paced action
Sense of satisfaction when you do well

Cons: 

Spawns are wonky sometimes
Can get repetitive with only one map
Gets frustrating if you force yourself too much

Would I recommend this game? Hell yes, for the low price of 2.19 it's definately worth it, although you may wish to buy Ubermosh Black instead for a similar price if you are willing to devote 1 more dollar to this kind of game :).

author: {'steamid': '76561197994465523', 'num_games_owned': 850, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1507841538}

author: {'steamid': '76561198109628359', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1601635553}
review: The idea of cutting the enemies bullets works so well and makes this one of the few games to truly express the saying, 'Easy to learn, hard to master.' Although each round is only 90 seconds the game just sucks you in and you will end up playing for hours. This is hands down the best $1 I've ever spent. This game is worth every penny you put into it, whether it's on sale or not. Another bonus is the amazing sound track that gets you super pumped and makes you feel even more badass while cutting bullets with a sword. The class mods bring a fun and difficult challenge to the game. I highly recommend this game to anyone who likes fun indie games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245670120', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1482717758}
review:
I got a coupon for this game from a friend and it was well worth getting. Cutting bullets with a sword and arcade-style gun-toting mayhem all rolled into one amazing package. The soundtrack is adrenaline-fuelled and it makes you want to keep on going. The class mods also add an interesting spin with each one having different effects.

If ever cyberpunk mosh pits become real, I want them to be like this. My only complaint is that there is some occasional slowdown when there's too much going on on-screen but it was only a minor occurence and did nothing to detract from the fun that this game is.

Well recommended and good for a quick burst of high-octane action.
